patrimônio ” − cidade grupo região nação patrimônio representação coletiva outra qualquer sim prática constituída processo atribuição valor deve reconhecido grupo disposto conserválo outras palavras texto seguir servirá base realização nove questões objetivas língua portuguesa redaçãotecnologia pode tirar ciências humanas idade média diz pierre lévyraphael hernandesfolha spaulo 10 setembro 2019 caderno ilustrada p c6são paulo – pierre lévy 63 começou escrever sobre cibercultura internet mato filósofo pioneiros tratar relação sociedade computador ciências humanas precisam passar revolução passaram naturais tecnologia chave atingir “ patamar mínimo ” “ humanidades ainda idade média ” “ vez desenvolver máquinas inteligentes deveríamos usar computadores tornar inteligentes ” diz filósofo quer reorganizar conhecimento trabalha linguagem faria humanos conversarem máquinas intermédio programação 2020 deve lançar livro explicando gramática dessa língua data editora definidoslévy nasceu tunísia desenvolveu carreira frança falou folha ante vir brasil onde participa fronteiras pensamento salvador nesta terçafeira 10 ingressos esgotados• pergunta 1 vivemos mundo conectado muda sociedadea chegada computadores pessoais internet smartphone aí vai transformam sistema comunicação sociedadeem novo sistema comunicação toda informação acessível onipresente pessoas interconectadas ainda importante robôs capazes automaticamente transformar símbolos fazer traduções cálculos estatísticos novo aconteceu apenas 20 30 ano difícil pensar implicações dessa mudança comunicação começo dessa nova civilização• pergunta 2 inteligência coletivaé algo velho ante espécie humana abelhas acumulam mel si comunidade formigas conseguem sinalizar onde coisas boa comer comunicação coordenação colaboração animais sociais frequente ainda forte mamíferos primatas inteligência coletiva algo outros animais têm linguagemela permite acumulemos conhecimento geração geração serve criar nova formas coordenar cooperar complexas mundo animalcada vez capazes fortalecer habilidade linguística agora comunicação digital aumentamos inteligência coletivaé quase oposto inteligência artificial contra objetivo geral deveria inteligência coletivahá muita memória comum disposição podemos aumentála conteúdo disponível digitalmente podemos aumentar habilidade coordenar colaborar exemplo uso redes sociais público geral empresas governos• pergunta 3 inteligência coletiva amarrada interneta biblioteca forma antiga memória coletiva internet nova forma vez ter palavras escritas papel códigos totalmente materiais têm computador algum lugar falta habilidade educação tirar melhor disso• pergunta 4 tirar melhor dessas possibilidadesvocê aprender controlar gerenciar atenção precisa poder categorizar dado corretamente avaliar confiança pode dar fontes informação capaz comparar diferentes fontes aprender comportar inteligência coletiva trabalhar outros fim transformar todos dado conhecimento• pergunta 5 onde entra big dataé nova forma memória hoje toda realidade representada mar dado tudo gera dado agora problema faremos extraímos conhecimento útil delese toda metodologia científica jogo aqui acho estatística sozinha gente precise precisamos categorizar todos dado hipóteses modelos causais estatística testar hipótesesé reprodução método científico todos começo transformação dado conhecimento• pergunta 6 onde linguagem artificial ieml sigla inglês metalinguagem economia informação encaixaieml língua característica ter semântica computável ter significado unívocohoje algoritmos capazes entender linguagem natural cálculos estatísticos ieml significado acessível pode usado sistema semântico universal faria análise big data extração conhecimento dado fácil dado categorizados linguagem natural porque línguas naturais irregulares diversas• pergunta 7 linguagem fazer conexão humanos máquinasexatamente criada linguagem máquinas podem entender pode traduzida línguas naturais humanos entendam diferente linguagem programaçãoa grande revolução científica frente ciências humanas fizemos revolução ciências naturais humanidades idade média meio uso dado disponíveis todo poder computacional usando ferramentas ieml categorizar dado expressar fatos teorias forma rigorosa poderíamos alcançar patamar mínimo tratamento científico humanidades• pergunta 8 sr vê futuro dessa sociedade digital conectadaduas coisas vão acontecer primeiro todo problema resolvido tecnologia nunca vai acontecer sempre vão surgir novos problemas segunda robôs vão assumir poder simplesmente impossível civilização vai evoluir forma difícil preveradaptadoos três parágrafos iniciais matéria jornalística raphael hernandes têm função

leia texto responder questões 11 19plenty of opportunity exist to study and work abroad but some earlycareer scientist might face challenge adjusting to different communication style and different workplace and academic hierarchiesit is important both to be sensitive to cultural difference and to avoid inadvertently stereotyping also assumption should not be made about student solely on the basis of their culture wealthy chinese student from hong kong example could see thing differently from one who come from rural area on the mainland and individual perception can vary too one student may personally encounter directness more often in the united kingdom than in the united state but others might not have experienced this the relationship between researcher and supervisor is influenced by many factor including personality previous experience and the workplace cultureone point of difference that can arise is the appropriate level of deference to supervisor some nigerian egyptian and chinese international student report that in their home nation large power differential between student and teacher is common and that student generally follow instruction without arguing but supervisor from country where debate is expected might sometimes incorrectly interpret lack of questioning from the student lack of interest in the work the absence of strictly defined hierarchy can encourage freer communication say salim reza radiationdetector scientist when he moved from his native bangladesh to sweden graduate study he learnt that he did not need to address faculty member ‘ sir ’ or ‘ professor ’ or remain standing in their office this informality made it easier him to approach professor to clarify topic or to propose new research anglesometimes though misunderstanding can stem from difference in communication style in some country the ‘ feedback sandwich ’ is common start with praise suggest improvement and end with encouragement student from country where this format is le common might think that because comment were mostly positive the suggestion are optional and can be ignored conversely student who is accustomed to gentler feedback might be ‘ traumatized ’ by cultural tendency in other country such germany or the netherlands to give more direct criticism senior researcher could smooth over difference by freely discussing how the student prefers to receive comment student could also talk to lab mate about the feedback hearing others ’ story could help them overcome discouragementwhether they are welcoming international student or starting work in new country scientist can ease the transition by remaining nonjudgemental people sometimes brush off student from another country ‘ rude ’ but “ in their culture they ’ re not ” researcher should also remember that their nation ’ s custom aren ’ t necessarily best “ when you come from small country you don ’ t assume everybody should be doing thing your way ” say croatian student “ i never cared if somebody wa different than long it didn ’ t seriously affect the rest of the lab ” roberta kwok wwwnaturecom 23052018 adaptadono trecho segundo parágrafo “ assumption should not be made ” leia trecho romance s bernardo graciliano ramos responder questões 02 07o caboclo malencarado encontrei dia casa mendonça acabou desgraça limpeza gente quase nunca morre direito un levados cobra outros cachaça outros matamsena pedreira perdi alavanca soltouse pedra bateulhe peito conta deixou viúva órfãos miúdos sumiramse meninos caiu fogo lombrigas comeram segundo último angina mulher enforcousepara diminuir mortalidade aumentar produção proibi aguardenteconcluiuse construção casa nova julgo preciso descrevêla partes principais apareceram aparecerão resto dispensável apenas pode interessar arquitetos homens provavelmente lerão ficou tudo confortável bonito naturalmente deixei dormir rede comprei móveis diversos objetos entrei utilizar receio outros ainda hoje utilizo porque sei servemaqui existe salto cinco ano cinco ano mundo dá bando voltasninguém imaginará topando obstáculos mencionados procedido invariavelmente segurança percorrido deter caminhos certos senhor procedi percorri abatimentos desejo recuar contornei dificuldades muitas curvas acham andei mal verdade nunca soube quais atos bons quais maus fiz coisas boa trouxeram prejuízo fiz coisas ruin deram lucro sempre intenção possuir terras s bernardo considerei legítimas ações levaram obtêlasalcancei esperava mercê deus vieramme ruga vê crédito princípio esquivava agarrouse comigo taxas desceram negócios desdobraramse automaticamente automatica mente difícil nada entram trilhos rodam beleza entram cruzem braços virem sorte metam pau tolices praticarem viram sabedoria visto criaturas trabalham demais progridem conheço indivíduos preguiçosos têm faro ocasião chega desenroscamse abrem boca – engolem tudoeu preguiçoso feliz primeiras tentativas obriguei fortuna serme favorável seguintesdepois morte mendonça derrubei cerca naturalmente leveia além ponto tempo salustiano padilha reclamações– senhoras mendonça pintou diabo enquanto viveu agora gostar paciência vá justiçacomo justiça cara justiça caminho aplainado invadi terra fidélis paralítico braço gama pandegavam recife estudando direito respeitei engenho dr magalhães juizviolências miúdas passaram despercebidas questões sérias ganhas foro graças chicanas joão nogueiraefetuei transações arriscadas endivideime importei maquinismos prestei atenção censuravam querer abarcar mundo pernas iniciei pomicultura avicultura levar remember the good old day when you could have heatedyetenjoyable debate with your friend about thing that didn ’ t matter that much — time when you could be true fan of the manchester united soccer team when you didn ’ t come from the city of manchesterhow thing have changednow disagreement feel deadly serious like when your colleague pronounces that wearing face mask in public is threat to his liberty or when you see that one of your friend ha just tweeted that actually all life matter before you know it you ’ re feeling angry and forming harsh new judgment about your colleague and friend let ’ s take collective pause and breathe there are some way we can all try to have more civil disagreement in this febrile age of culture wars1 ‘ coupling ’ and ‘ decoupling ’ the first is to consider how inclined people are to ‘ couple ’ or ‘ decouple ’ topic involving wider political and social factor swedish data analyst john nerst ha used the term to describe the contrasting way in which people approach contentious issue those of u more inclined to ‘ couple ’ see them inextricably related to broader matrix of factor whereas those more predisposed to ‘ decouple ’ prefer to consider an issue in isolation to take crude example decoupler might consider in isolation the question of whether vaccine provides degree of immunity to virus coupler by contrast would immediately see the issue inextricably entangled in mesh of factor such pharmaceutical industry power and parental choice2 most of u are deeply committed to our belief especially concerning moral and social issue such that when we ’ re presented with fact that contradict our belief we often choose to dismiss those fact rather than update our beliefsa study at arizona state university u analysed more than 100000 comment on forum where user post their view on an issue and invite others to persuade them to change their mind the researcher found that regardless of the kind of topic people were more likely to change their mind when confronted with more evidence based argument “ our work may suggest that while attitude change is hardwon providing fact statistic and citation one ’ s argument can convince people to change their mind ” they concluded3 just be nicerfinally it ’ s easier said than done but let ’ s all try to be more respectful of and attentive to each other ’ s position we should this not just virtuous reason but because the more we create that kind of climate the more openminded and intellectually flexible we will all be inclined to be and then hopefully collectively we can start having more constructive disagreement — even in our present very difficult timeschristian jarrett wwwbbccom 14102020 adaptadoin the fragment from the fourth paragraph “ those of u more inclined to ‘ couple ’ see them inextricably related to broader matrix of factor ” the underlined term refers most specifically to

digital desafia exercício profissional “ medicina sobreviverá velho método médico família adaptar ” afirmação desembargador tribunal justiça distrito federal territórios tjdft diaulas costa ribeiro proferida durante mesa redonda “ panorama atual mídias sociais aplicativos medicina contemporânea ” nova tecnologias trazem desafios precisam colocados perspectiva garantir ética sigilo “ possivelmente vamos chegar medicina gosto distanciada funciona talvez fim recomeço ” ponderou ribeiro segundo ante gerar novo modelo atendimento médico “ dr google ” – termo utilizou indicar buscas informações médicas internet – gerou novo tipo paciente passou conhecer sobre doenças exige novo rela cio mento médicoo desembargador ainda reforçou necessidade rediscutir questões uso internet nessa relação médicopaciente segurança sigilo médico neste cenário “ precisamos refletir sobre algumas questões importantes guardará sigilo haverá sigilo sigilo médico mantido valerá direito público informação conflitos reinventados mesmos solução problemas sempre ” indagouética – perspectiva médico legista professor universidade brasília unb malthus galvão embora acredite algumas mudanças inevitáveis necessárias preciso defender princípios fundamentais instituídos código ética médica cem “ nova mídias devem entendidas sistema interação social compartilhamento criação colaborativa informação diversos formatos podemos perder oportunidade ” destacou lembra exemplo desde resolução cfm 16432002 define disciplina prestação serviços através telemedicina alguns avanços colaborativos possíveisgalvão apresentou ainda preceitos resolução cfm 19742011 lei ato médico 128422013 chamando atenção alguns cuidados médico deve ter divulgar conteúdo forma sensacionalista “ segundo cem vedada divulgação informação sobre assunto médico forma sensaciona lista promocional conteúdo inverídico internet deve usada instrumento promoção saúde orientação população ” reforçoueditorial jornal medicina – publicação oficial conselho federal medicina cfm brasília jul 2017 p 7no primeiro parágrafo editorial cfm aspas empregadas respectivamente demarcar

atenção questões números 1 12 referemse texto segueum filme nacional 2003 − narradores ja vé eliane caffé − mostra vilarejo fictício amea çado inundado grande represa pobres esquecidos todos habitantes sabem defender voz parece encontrar solução javé precisa reconhecida “ patri mônio ” poi assim tornaria cidade submersa duas dimensões dessa fala merecem assinaladas “ patrimônio ” aparece recurso reivindicação palavra enuncia naquela específica cena evidencia quanto deixou termo técnico especializado vinculado saber política formal tornar lugarcomum táfora poderosa submersão equivale esque cimento reconhecimento reivin dicação posse patrimônio demanda visibilidade desprovidos recursos materiais pudessem considerados valor histórico narradores javé podem recordar reinventar histórias mito fundação patrimônio hoje chamamos imaterial intangívelo termo “ patrimônio ” latim pater pai tornouse corriqueiro adjetivação espraiou patrimônio pode histórico ambiental arqueológico artístico material imaterial etc qualificações comumente subsumidas sob guardachuva “ cultural ” remissão pai patriarca conduz legado herança acaso termo inglês exatamente heritageno filme citado bastava reconhecer algo importante preciso escrever anotar identificar – passar adiante conjunto práticas pode transmutar relatos estórias passadas conversas informais costume “ patrimônio ” − cidade grupo região nação patrimônio representação coletiva outra qualquer sim prática constituída processo atribuição valor deve reconhecido grupo disposto conserválo outras palavras patrimônio histórico remete políticas públicas ações têm lugar esfera públicaos grupos sociais atribuem valores distintos ben materiais memórias marcas territoriais nomeiam − desse modo distinguem clas sificam − ambiente rodeia destacam passagens história comum passado coletivo elegem paisagens falamos patrimônio histórico cultural etc disso trata conjunto ben materiais ima teriais fruto decisão partiu identificação algo merecia destacado retirado certo fluxo corriqueiro coisas rotina cotidiana bem tido especial bem chamase bem patrimonialo termo hoje lugarcomum duplo sentido corriqueiro parece discurso todos pode lugar compartilhado ponto encontro saberes disciplinas políticas contudo diante fenômeno universal tampouco permanente frança preocupações patrimônio usar termo então uti lizado monumentos início após revo lução francesa inglaterra meio revolução industrial vitorianos denunciavam civiliza ção moderna percebida raízes voltavam passado préindustrial localizado arquitetura brasil descoberta patri mônio iminência perdido vinculou revolução qualquer tipo debate início nada revolucionária primeira república 18891930 cidades passavam reformas urbana pautadas “ bota abaixo ” − ocorreu rio janeiro recife começo século xx − consolidouse estado novoadaptado rubino silvana patrimônio história memória reivindicação recurso in agenda brasileira temas deuma sociedade mudança orgs andré botelho lilia moritzschwarcz paulo companhia letras 2011 p 392 393considere afirmações seguema palavra lugarcomum composta elementos pertencentes mesmas class gramaticais compõem vocábulo guardachuvaas palavras imaterial intangível apresentam elemento formação valor semânticoa palavra guardachuva empregada texto exemplifica fenômeno polissemiaestá correto afirma

highflying ideasa cameraequipped drone fly around the outskirt of seoul south korea hovering near an industrial plant and capturing video of pollutant below on the crowded littercovered street resident wear white and black mask that cover their nose and mouth gray haze hang in the skythe unmanned aerial vehicle or uav is part of pilot program by south korea ’ s ministry of environment tasked with inspecting factory emission in the capital ’ s greater metropolitan area it ’ s the latest in series of tech solution aimed at solving seoul ’ s dust dilemma in fact the fine dust ha south leia texto responder questões 11 20can plant hearflora may be able to detect thesounds of flowing water or munching insectspseudoscientific claim that music help plant grow have beenmade fordecadesdespiteevidencethat is shaky at best yet new research suggests some flora may be capable of sensing sound such the gurgle of water through pipe or the buzzing of insectsina recentstudymonicagaglianoan evolutionary biologistatthe university of western australiaand hercolleagues placed pea seedling inpots shaped like an upsidedown y one armof each pot wa placedineither tray of wateroracoiled plastictube through which waterflowed the other arm had dry soil the root grew toward the arm of the pipewith the fluid regardlessof whether it wa easily accessible or hidden inside the tubing they just knew the water wa there even if the only thing to detect wa the sound of it flowing inside the pipe gagliano say yet when the seedlingsweregiven achoicebetweenthewatertube and some moistenedsoiltheirroots favoredthe latter she hypothesizesthat theseplants use sound wave todetectwater at distance but follow moisture gradient to home in on their target when it is closertheresearchreported earlier thisyearinoecologiaisnot the first to suggest flora can detect and interpret sound 2014 study showed the rock cress arabidopsis can distinguish between caterpillar chewingsounds and wind vibration – theplantproduced morechemicaltoxinsafterhearing recording of feeding insect we tend to underestimate plant becausetheir response areusually lessvisibletous but leaf turn out to be extremely sensitive vibration detector sayslead study author heidi mappelan environmental scientist now at the university of toledomarta zaraska wwwscientificamericancom 17052017in the excerpt from the third paragraph “ the first to suggest flora can detect ” the word in bold indicates

sometimes it is the very ordinariness of scene that make it terrifying so it wa with clip from recent bbc documentary on facial recognition technology man try to avoid the camera covering his face by pulling up his jacket he is stopped by the police and forced to have his photo taken he is then fined £90 “ disorderly behavior ” “ what ’ s your suspicion ” someone asks the police “ the fact that he ’ s walked past clearly masking his face from recognition ” reply one of the officer if you want to protect your privacy it must be because you have something to hidethere is considerable concern in the west about chinese tech firm acting trojan horse beijing but perhaps we should worry le about the tech company than about the social use of technology because it ’ s not just in china that “ algorithmic governance ” is beginning to take hold the tech entrepreneur maciej ceglowski pointed out before the u senate “ until recently even people living in police state could count on the fact that the authority didn ’ t have enough equipment or manpower to observe everyone everywhere and so enjoyed more freedom from monitoring than we living in free society today ” surveillance is at the heart too of “ smart city ” from amsterdam to dubai to toronto city are embracing technology to collect data on citizen ostensibly to make public service and urban space function better but what smart city also enable is new form of policing the mayor of rio janeiro said of the “ integrated urban command centre ” built the 2016 olympics the system “ allows u to have people looking into every corner of the city 24 hour day seven day week ” bus that run on time and rubbish that is efficiently cleared are good thing in most smart city and in rio well neither actually happens there is however more to the good life than an ordered city human flourishing requires the existence of sphere of life outside public scrutiny not only within the intimacy of the home but also in semiprivate space such the workplace or the church or the pub it ’ s that kind of space shielded from scrutiny that increasingly is vanishing ceglowski observed one of the feature of the “ new world of ambient surveillance ” is that “ we can not opt out of it any more than we might opt out of automobile culture by refusing to drive ” and that is possibly the most disturbing thought of allkenan malik wwwtheguardiancom 19052019 adaptadorio janeiro is mentioned in the third and fourth paragraph because it

the rise of antibiotic resistanceby the editorial boardmay 10 2014the world health organization ha surveyed thegrowth of antibioticresistant germ around the world – the first such survey it ha ever conducted – and come upwith disturbing finding ln report issued late last month the organization found that antimicrobial resistance in bacteria the main focus of the report fungi virus and parasite is an increasingly serious threat in every part of the world “ problem so serious that it threatens the achievement of modern medicine ” the organization said “ postantibioticera in which common infection and minor injury can kill far from being an apocalyptic fantasy is instead very real possibility the 21st century ” the growth of antibioticresistant pathogen meansthat in ever more case standard treatment longer work infection are harder or impossible to control the risk of spreading infection to others is increased and illness and hospital stay are prolonged ali of these drive up the cost of illness and the risk of dealh the survey sought to determine the scope of the problem by asking country to submit their most recent surveillance data 114 did so unfortunately the data wa glaringly incomplete because few country track and monitor antibiotic resistance comprehensively and there is standard methodology doing sostill it is clear that major resistance problem have already developed both antibiotic that are used routinely and those deemed “ last resort ” treatrnents to cure people when all else ha failed carbapenem antibiotic class of drug used last resort to treat lifethreatening infection caused by common intestinal bacterium have failed to work in more than half thepeople treated in some country the bacterium is major cause of hospitalacquired infection such pneumonia bloodstream infection and infection in newborn and intensivecare patient similarly the failure of lastresort treatment gonorrhoea ha been confirmed in 10 country including many with advanced health care system such australia canada france sweden and britain and resistance to class of antibiotic that is routinely used to treat urinary tract infection caused by coliis widespread in some country the drug are now ineffective in more than half of the patient treated this sobering report is intended to kickstart global campaign to develop tool and standard to track drug resistance measure it health and economic impact and design solutionsthe most urgent need is to minimize the overuse of antibiotic in medicine and agriculture which accelerates the development of resistant strain in the united statesthe food and drug administration fda ha issued voluntary guideline calling on drug company animal producer and veterinarian to stop indiscriminately using antibiotic that are important treating human on livestock the drug company have said they will comply but the agency shortsightedly ha appealed court order requiring it to ban the use of penicillin and two form of tetracycline by animal producer to promote growth unless they provide proof that il will not promote drugresistant microbesthe pharmaceutical industry need to be encouragedto develop new antibiotic to supplement those that arelosing their effectiveness the royal pharmaceutical society which represents pharmacist in britain called this month stronger financial incentive it said that new class of antibiotic ha been discovered since 1987 largely because the financial return finding new class of antibiotic are too low unlike lucrative drug to treat chronic disease like cancer and cardiovascular ailment antibiotic are typically taken short period of time and any new drug is apt to be used sparingly and held in reserve to treat patient resistant to existing drug antibiotic have transformed medicine and saved countless life over the past seven decade now rampant overuse and the lack of new drug in the pipeline threaten to undermine their effectivenesswwwnytimes adaptadosegundo último parágrafo texto

el eclipsecuando fray bartolomé arrazola sentió perdido aceptó ya nada podría salvarlo la selva poderosa guatemala lo había apresado implacable y definitiva ante su ignorancia topográfica sentó con tranquilidad esperar la muerte al despertar encontró rodeado un grupo indígenas rostro impasible disponía sacrificarlo ante un altar un altar bartolomé le pareció el lecho en descansaría al fin sus temores su destino sí mismo tres años en el país le habían conferido un mediano dominio la lenguas nativas intentó algo dijo algunas palabras fueron comprendidas entonces floreció en él una idea tuvo digna su talento y su cultura universal y su arduo conocimiento aristóteles recordó ese día esperaba un eclipse total sol y dispuso en lo más íntimo valerse aquel conocimiento engañar sus opresores y salvar la vida – si matáis – le dijo – puedo hacer el sol oscurezca en su altura los indígenas lo miraron fijamente y bartolomé sorprendió la incredulidad en sus ojos vio produjo un pequeño consejo y esperó confiado sin cierto desdén horas después el corazón fray bartolomé arrazola chorreaba su sangre vehemente sobre la piedra los sacrifícios brillante bajo la opaca luz un sol eclipsado mientras uno los indígenas recitaba sin ninguna inflexión voz sin prisa una una la infinitas fechas en producirían eclipse solares y lunares los atrónomos la comunidad maya habían previsto y anotado en sus códices sin la valiosa ayuda aristóteles monterroso obras completas y otros cuentosbogotá norma 1994 adaptadono texto confrontamse duas visões mundo cultura ocidental representada frei bartolomé arrazola mítica préhispânica representada comunidade indígena maia segundo narrativa

leia texto responder questões 11 19plenty of opportunity exist to study and work abroad but some earlycareer scientist might face challenge adjusting to different communication style and different workplace and academic hierarchiesit is important both to be sensitive to cultural difference and to avoid inadvertently stereotyping also assumption should not be made about student solely on the basis of their culture wealthy chinese student from hong kong example could see thing differently from one who come from rural area on the mainland and individual perception can vary too one student may personally encounter directness more often in the united kingdom than in the united state but others might not have experienced this the relationship between researcher and supervisor is influenced by many factor including personality previous experience and the workplace cultureone point of difference that can arise is the appropriate level of deference to supervisor some nigerian egyptian and chinese international student report that in their home nation large power differential between student and teacher is common and that student generally follow instruction without arguing but supervisor from country where debate is expected might sometimes incorrectly interpret lack of questioning from the student lack of interest in the work the absence of strictly defined hierarchy can encourage freer communication say salim reza radiationdetector scientist when he moved from his native bangladesh to sweden graduate study he learnt that he did not need to address faculty member ‘ sir ’ or ‘ professor ’ or remain standing in their office this informality made it easier him to approach professor to clarify topic or to propose new research anglesometimes though misunderstanding can stem from difference in communication style in some country the ‘ feedback sandwich ’ is common start with praise suggest improvement and end with encouragement student from country where this format is le common might think that because comment were mostly positive the suggestion are optional and can be ignored conversely student who is accustomed to gentler feedback might be ‘ traumatized ’ by cultural tendency in other country such germany or the netherlands to give more direct criticism senior researcher could smooth over difference by freely discussing how the student prefers to receive comment student could also talk to lab mate about the feedback hearing others ’ story could help them overcome discouragementwhether they are welcoming international student or starting work in new country scientist can ease the transition by remaining nonjudgemental people sometimes brush off student from another country ‘ rude ’ but “ in their culture they ’ re not ” researcher should also remember that their nation ’ s custom aren ’ t necessarily best “ when you come from small country you don ’ t assume everybody should be doing thing your way ” say croatian student “ i never cared if somebody wa different than long it didn ’ t seriously affect the rest of the lab ” roberta kwok wwwnaturecom 23052018 adaptadoin the excerpt from the fourth paragraph “ sometimes though misunderstanding can stem from difference incommunication style ” the underlined word express theidea of

responder questões 07 10 leia trecho livro oráculo noite neurocientista sidarta ribeiroa palavra sonho latim somnium significa muitas coisas diferentes toda vivenciadas durante vigília durante sono realizei “ sonho vida ” “ sonho consumo ” frases usadas cotidianamente pessoas dizer pretendem conseguiram alcançar algo todo mundo sonho sentido plano futuro todo mundo deseja algo sonho fenômeno normalmente noturno tanto pode evocar prazer quanto medo justamente palavra usada designar tudo quer tero repertório publicitário contemporâneo dúvidas sonho força motriz comportamentos desejo sinônimo preciso palavra “ sonho ” área desembarque aeroporto estados unidos foto enorme casal belo sorridente velejando mar caribenho dia ensolarado sob frase enigmática “ aonde sonhos levarão ” embaixo logotipo empresa cartão crédito deduzse anúncio sonhos veleiros capazes levarnos lugares idílicos perfeitos altamente… desejáveis equações “ sonho igual desejo igual dinheiro ” têm variável oculta liberdade ir principalmente ter liberdade miseráveis podem experimentar mundo regras frouxas sonho noturno sonho diurno privilégio apenas detentores mágico cartão plásticoa rotina trabalho diário falta tempo dormir sonhar acometem maioria trabalhadores cruciais malestar civilização contemporânea gritante contraste relevância motivacional sonho banalização mundo industrial globalizado indústria saúde sono setor cresce aceleradamente valor estimado 30 bilhões 40 bilhões dólares assim insônia impera tempo sempre escasso despertamos diariamente toque insistente despertador ainda sonolentos atrasados cumprir compromissos renovam infinito tão poucos lembram sonham simple falta oportunidade contemplar vida interior insônia grassa bocejo impõe chegase duvidar sobrevivência sonhoe entanto sonhase sonhase granel sonhase sofregamente apesar luzes ruídos cidade incessante faina vida tristeza perspectivas dirá formiga cética sonha assim tão livre artista cigarra fábula vive brisa peça teatral vida sonho espanhol pedro calderón la barca dramatizou liberdade construir próprio destino sonho imaginação freio controle solta temer criar perder acharo oráculo noite história ciência atenção questões números 1 11 referemse texto segue livrohuman nature in politics publicado 1908 deputado inglês graham wallas criticou tendência época difundida imaginar políticos pudessem encarnar padrão racionalidade devoção bem comum virtude cívica postulado filósofos século xviii políticos – escreveu – representam natureza humana defeitos qualidades menos wallas primeiro destacar fosso abrira política real desenrola parlamento noutros órgãos estado percepção parte opinião pública fato iluminismo criara noção psicologicamente superficial cidadão filosofante nada ver cidadãos carne osso reflexões realistas sobre tal discrepância demoraram aparecer wallas tendo sido pioneira instigantes hoje sabemos fenômeno descrito wallas especificamente inglês passageiro apareceu reação disfunções características estágios iniciais democracia representativa questionamentos semelhantes continuam manifestar toda parte duas vertentes nitidamente diferen ciadas notou referente atitudes cidadão comum relação funcionamento instituições sobretudo legislativos partidos políticos outra propriamente filosófica refere ideologia liberal mundo modernoo azedume primeira vertente sido regularmente pesquisado entidades acadêmicas todo mundo difícil dizer existe consenso quanto causa formas características antídotos administrados eficácia duvidosa têm sido basicamente reformas institucionais concentrandose principalmente sistemas partidários eleitorais tudo faz crer cidadão comum quer ordem quer estado capaz mantêla deseja diluição destruição poder menos experiências anar quistas tresloucadas despreza “ política ” sentido comumente atribuído termo hesitaria acabar soubesse fazêlo valoriza finalidade última estado abomina meio atua sistema político raiz desse sentimento parece fator psicológico – desconforto cidadão comum diante certas exterioridades política cujas funções chega compreender bem luta políticos controle partidos chapas eleitorais labirinto táticas combate parlamentar retórica quase sempre entediante caráter vago francamente inexequível maioria promessas feitas durante campanhas outras segunda vertente nutrese ideias filosóficas estéticas abrangentes radicais formouse bojo grandes transformações lugar europa desde século xviii base materiais sociedade revolução industrial conflito class esfera estado direito transição absolutismo estado constitucional plano cultura arte chamada “ idade ideologia ” advento romantismo sob decisivo influxo obra jeanjacques rousseaulamounier bolivar liberais antiliberais luta ideológica tempo paulo companhia letras 2016 p 15 17de fato iluminismo criara noção psicologicamente superficial cidadão filosofantena transposição frase acima voz passiva forma corretamente empregada

responder questões de02a05 leia trecho livroo homem cordial sérgio buarque holanda disse expressão feliz contribuição brasileira civilização cordialidade — daremos mundo “ homem cordial ” lhaneza¹ trato hospitalidade generosidade virtudes tão gabadas estrangeiros visitam representam efeito traço definido caráter brasileiro medida menos permanece ativa fecunda influência ancestral padrões convívio humano informados meio rural patriarcal engano supor virtudes possam significar “ boa maneiras ” civilidade ante tudo expressões legítimas fundo emotivo extremamente rico transbordante civilidade qualquer coisa coercitivo — pode exprimirse mandamentos sentenças japoneses onde sabe polidez envolve aspectos ordinários convívio social chega ponto confundirse vezes reverência religiosa notasse fato significativo formas exteriores veneração divindade cerimonial xintoísta diferem essencialmente maneiras sociais demonstrar respeitonenhum povo distante dessa noção ritualista vida brasileiro forma ordinária convívio social fundo justamente contrário polidez pode iludir aparência — explica fato atitude polida consistir precisamente espécie mímica deliberada manifestações espontâneas “ homem cordial ” forma natural viva converteu fórmula além disso polidez algum modo organização defesa ante sociedade detémse parte exterior epidérmica indivíduo podendo servir necessário peça resistência equivale disfarce permitirá cada preservar intatas sensibilidade emoções meio semelhante padronização formas exteriores cordialidade precisam legítimas manifestarem revelase decisivo triunfo espírito sobre vida armado dessa máscara indivíduo consegue manter supremacia ante social efetivamente polidez implica presença contínua soberana indivíduono “ homem cordial ” vida sociedade certo modo verdadeira libertação pavor sente viver consigo apoiarse sobre si próprio toda circunstâncias existência maneira expansão outros reduz indivíduo cada vez parcela social periférica brasileiro — bom americano — tende importa ante viver outroso homem cordial 2012¹lhaneza afabilidadeestá empregado sentido figurado termo sublinhado

leia texto responder questões 16 25remember the good old day when you could have heatedyetenjoyable debate with your friend about thing that didn ’ t matter that much — time when you could be true fan of the manchester united soccer team when you didn ’ t come from the city of manchesterhow thing have changednow disagreement feel deadly serious like when your colleague pronounces that wearing face mask in public is threat to his liberty or when you see that one of your friend ha just tweeted that actually all life matter before you know it you ’ re feeling angry and forming harsh new judgment about your colleague and friend let ’ s take collective pause and breathe there are some way we can all try to have more civil disagreement in this febrile age of culture wars1 ‘ coupling ’ and ‘ decoupling ’ the first is to consider how inclined people are to ‘ couple ’ or ‘ decouple ’ topic involving wider political and social factor swedish data analyst john nerst ha used the term to describe the contrasting way in which people approach contentious issue those of u more inclined to ‘ couple ’ see them inextricably related to broader matrix of factor whereas those more predisposed to ‘ decouple ’ prefer to consider an issue in isolation to take crude example decoupler might consider in isolation the question of whether vaccine provides degree of immunity to virus coupler by contrast would immediately see the issue inextricably entangled in mesh of factor such pharmaceutical industry power and parental choice2 most of u are deeply committed to our belief especially concerning moral and social issue such that when we ’ re presented with fact that contradict our belief we often choose to dismiss those fact rather than update our beliefsa study at arizona state university u analysed more than 100000 comment on forum where user post their view on an issue and invite others to persuade them to change their mind the researcher found that regardless of the kind of topic people were more likely to change their mind when confronted with more evidence based argument “ our work may suggest that while attitude change is hardwon providing fact statistic and citation one ’ s argument can convince people to change their mind ” they concluded3 just be nicerfinally it ’ s easier said than done but let ’ s all try to be more respectful of and attentive to each other ’ s position we should this not just virtuous reason but because the more we create that kind of climate the more openminded and intellectually flexible we will all be inclined to be and then hopefully collectively we can start having more constructive disagreement — even in our present very difficult timeschristian jarrett wwwbbccom 14102020 adaptadothe first and second paragraph mainly illustrate

atenção responder questões números 73 75 considere texto abaixohomeopathic treatment prolonged postoperative coma case reportg vithoulkas v văcăraș j kavouras ad buzoianu m mărginean d văcăraș and s cozmaalthough rare complication postoperative coma is severe deathleading condition causing immense suffering on both the patient and the patient ’ s family multidisciplinary and thorough approach is necessary these patient but even after wellconducted therapy this condition often lead to the death of the patientthis article present case of an 81year old female patient with many severe illness who recovered from prolonged postoperative coma with the aid of homeopathythe homeopathic approach is completely different from the classical allopathic one if the allopathic medicine ha the tendency to suppress any symptom homeopathy us these symptom in order to choose the correct remedy the remedy that would produce the same symptom in healthy person given to sick person this remedy will activate that person ’ s own defense mechanism which will grow stronger and lead that person ’ s organism to selfhealingthe healing depends mostly on the organism ’ s level of health when the illness occurs if the organism is in one of the and b group level 16 one can get to healing by the administration of either one or succession of 2 3 4 correct homeopathic remedy if the organism is in one of the c and d group level 712 the chance of healing are limited in these case we can only ease the patient ’ s suffering or if the patient is in the c group climb up the level of health and even reach healing by the correct administration of several remedy but during longer period of timedespite complex and correctly performed therapeutic effort the elderly patient did not regain consciousness and wa still in deep coma in the fourteenth day post operatory without having confirmed medical explanationat that point the patient ’ s family requested consult from homeopathic specialistthe homeopathic examination which wa performed on the fourteenth day postoperatively revealed the following old comatose tranquil patient with pale and cold skin with the need to uncover herself the few movement that she made with her hand were to remove her blanket and clothes if she felt “ thirst air ” abdominal distension and bloatingthe symptom taken into account in the case of this elderly patient were the unconsciousness the pale skin the cyanotic lip and finger tip the “ thirst air ” − the wish to uncover herself even if the body temperature wa low the abdominal distension the remedy of choice these symptom wa carbo vegetabilis remedy known it usefulness in critical situation having starting point especially circulatorycardiac problemsthe patient ’ s condition improved in spectacular manner she regained consciousness however she wa in state of extreme physical exhaustion caused by the simple act of talking eating or slightly moving her limb that state led to the administration of the following remedy stanum metallicum it is remedy known it usefulness in extreme physical exhaustion state where even the slightest effort lead to the patient feeling ihowever in this case considering the patient ’ s medical history her age and her multiple illness homeopathy wa used complementary treatment to the classical allopathic treatment the patient underwent it primary purpose being to aid the body in activating it own healing mechanismsconsidering the severity of postoperative complication such coma and the impact it ha not only on the patient but also on the patient ’ s family we believe that the case we presented should bring new light on the use of complementary therapy such homeopathy viable solution in the management of the patient suffering from severe conditionsadapted pediatric group advises parent to read to kidsjune 26 2014by amy graffreading go dog go to your 6 month old might seem like wasted time because she ’ s more likely to eat the book than help you turn the page but statement released by the american academy of pediatrics aap this week say reading in the early year is essential reading out loud get parent talking to their baby and the sound of an adult ’ s voice stimulates that tiny yet rapidly growing brain in the statement the academy advises pediatrician to tell parent to read book to their child from birthreading regularly with young child stimulates optimal pattern of brain development and strengthens parentchild relationship at critical time in child development which in turn build language literacy and socialemotional skill that last lifetime research show that child ’ s brain develops fastar between 0 and 3 than at any other time in life making the early year critical time baby to hear rich oral language the more word child hear directed at them by parent and caregiver the more they learnwhile many baby are read goodnight moon and the very hungry caterpillar every night before bed others never get chance to “ pat the bunny ” study reveal that child from lowincome lesseducated family have significantly fewer book than their more affluent peer by age 4 child in poverty hear 30 million fewer word that those in higherincome household these dramatic gap result in significant learning disadvantage that persist into adulthood the aap hope the new guideline will encourage all parent to start reading from day oneresearch show that when pediatrician talk with parent about reading mom and dad are more likely to fill their home with book and read also to help get more parent reading the aap is partnering with organization such scholastic and too small to fail to help get reading material to new family who need book the mostthis is the first time the aap ha made recommendation on child ’ s literary education and it seems the timing might be just right more and more parent are leaning on screen and electronic gadget to occupy their baby “ the reality of today ’ s world is that we ’ re competing with portable digital medium ” dr alanna levine pediatrician in orangeburg ny told the new york time “ so you really want to arm parent with tool and rationale behind it about why it ’ s important to stick to the basic of thing like book ” httpblogseattlepicom adaptadoo trecho último parágrafo “ it ’ s important to stick to the basic of thing like book ” pode entendido

made headway in the global scenario question were raised about how stable and scalable it wa at macro level unstable policy powering future growth were exacerbated by technological funding nevertheless clean energy installation continued to grow albeit slowly until dramatic leap few year agoan unprecedented drop in the cost of producing clean energy ha occurred in the last couple of year it is becoming the cheapest source of power more and more countriesthese heady decline in cost are likely to continue over the next decadegiven it increasing affordability the application and use case of renewable energy have broadened alongside electricity production it is providing new solution mobility and energy security worldwidethe electric vehicle market is growing rapidly with china leading the way and european and american market following suit country like india are already targeting complete electrification of it vehicular fleet by 2030 the affordability and widespread use of electric vehicle is being driven in part by falling battery cost these enable further energy stability solution including windsolar hybrid generationtoday fifth of the world ’ s electricity is produced by renewable energy in 2016 there were 160gw of clean energy installation globally this is 10 more than in 2015 but they cost almost quarter le new solar power gave the biggest boost providing half of all new capacity followed by wind power which provided third and hydropower which gave 15 it wa the first year in history that added solar capacity outstripped any other electricityproducing technologycareful protectionism or liberalisation of the renewables sector – according to each country ’ s requirement – is necessary so not to harm sector growth in the long run there must be balance between fair competition on the one hand and incentive company to focus on development on the other hand while gaining good return on their investment government must and manufacturing commitment that support clean energyrenewable energy is global phenomenon on the upswing the foreseeable future it growth is set to accelerate but we have to ensure that progress is made tingling in your extremity are usually the first symptom spreading to your upper body and arm in about half of people with the disorder symptom begin in the arm or face guillainbarré syndrome progress muscle weakness can evolve into paralysisguillainbarré syndrome can affect all age group but men and young adult are at slightly greater riskguillainbarré syndrome is serious condition that requires immediate hospitalization because it can worsen rapidly the sooner appropriate treatment is started …i… the chance of good outcomeonce thought to be single disorder guillainbarré syndrome is now known to occur in several form the main type are− acute inflammatory demyelinating polyradiculoneuropathy aidp the most common form in the u it most common sign is muscle weakness that start in the lower part of your body and spread upward− miller fisher syndrome mf in which paralysis start in the eye mf is also associated with unsteady gait mf occurs in about 5 percent of people with guillainbarré syndrome in the u but is more common in asia− acute motor axonal neuropathy aman and acute motorsensory axonal neuropathy amsan are le common in the u both are more frequent in china japan and mexicothe exact cause of guillainbarré syndrome isn ’ t known the disorder usually appears day or week after respiratory or digestive tract infection rarely recent surgery or immunization can trigger guillainbarré syndrome recently there have been few case reported following infection with the zika virusin guillainbarré syndrome your immune system − which usually attack only invading organism − begin attacking the nerve in aidp the nerve ’ protective covering myelin sheath is damaged because nerve control your movement and body function the damage prevents nerve from transmitting signal to your brain causing weakness numbness or paralysispeople with guillainbarré may experiencebreathing difficulty the weakness or paralysis can spread to the muscle that control your breathing potentially fatal complication up to 30 percent of people with guillainbarré syndrome need temporary help from machine to breathe when theyre hospitalized treatmentresidual numbness or other sensation most people with guillainbarré syndrome recover completely or have only minor residual weakness numbness or tinglingbowel and bladder function problem sluggish bowel function and urine retention may result from guillain barré syndromeblood clot people who are immobile due to guillain barré syndrome are at risk of developing blood clot until youre able to walk independently taking blood thinner and wearing support stocking may be recommendedtheres known cure guillainbarré syndrome but several treatment can ease symptom and reduce the duration of the illnessadapted from wwwmayoclinicorgde acordo texto

pediatric group advises parent to read to kidsjune 26 2014by amy graffreading go dog go to your 6 month old might seem like wasted time because she ’ s more likely to eat the book than help you turn the page but statement released by the american academy of pediatrics aap this week say reading in the early year is essential reading out loud get parent talking to their baby and the sound of an adult ’ s voice stimulates that tiny yet rapidly growing brain in the statement the academy advises pediatrician to tell parent to read book to their child from birthreading regularly with young child stimulates optimal pattern of brain development and strengthens parentchild relationship at critical time in child development which in turn build language literacy and socialemotional skill that last lifetime research show that child ’ s brain develops fastar between 0 and 3 than at any other time in life making the early year critical time baby to hear rich oral language the more word child hear directed at them by parent and caregiver the more they learnwhile many baby are read goodnight moon and the very hungry caterpillar every night before bed others never get chance to “ pat the bunny ” study reveal that child from lowincome lesseducated family have significantly fewer book than their more affluent peer by age 4 child in poverty hear 30 million fewer word that those in higherincome household these dramatic gap result in significant learning disadvantage that persist into adulthood the aap hope the new guideline will encourage all parent to start reading from day oneresearch show that when pediatrician talk with parent about reading mom and dad are more likely to fill their home with book and read also to help get more parent reading the aap is partnering with organization such scholastic and too small to fail to help get reading material to new family who need book the mostthis is the first time the aap ha made recommendation on child ’ s literary education and it seems the timing might be just right more and more parent are leaning on screen and electronic gadget to occupy their baby “ the reality of today ’ s world is that we ’ re competing with portable digital medium ” dr alanna levine pediatrician in orangeburg ny told the new york time “ so you really want to arm parent with tool and rationale behind it about why it ’ s important to stick to the basic of thing like book ” httpblogseattlepicom adaptadono trecho primeiro parágrafo “ that tiny yet rapidly growing brain ” termo destaque indica

leia excerto crônica “ mineirinho ” clarice lispector 19251977 publicada revista senhor 1962 responder questões 25 30é suponho mim representantes devo procurar doendo morte facínora1 adianta contar treze tiro mataram mineirinho2 crime perguntei cozinheira pensava sobre assunto vi rosto pequena convulsão conflito malestar entender sente precisar trair sensações contraditórias saber harmonizálas fatos irredutíveis revolta irredutível violenta compaixão revolta sentirse dividido própria perplexidade diante poder esquecer mineirinho perigoso matara demais entanto queríamos vivo cozinheira fechou pouco vendome talvez justiça vinga alguma raiva mim mexendo alma respondeu fria “ sinto serve dizer sabe mineirinho criminoso certeza salvou entrou céu ” respondilhe “ muita gente matou ” quê entanto primeira lei protege corpo vida insubstituíveis matarás maior garantia assim matam porque quero morrer assim deixam matar porque ter matado escuridão mimesta lei alguma coisa faz ouvir primeiro segundo tiro alívio segurança terceiro deixa alerta quarto desassossegada quinto sexto cobrem vergonha sétimo oitavo ouço coração batendo horror nono décimo boca trêmula décimo primeiro digo espanto nome deus décimo segundo chamo irmão décimo terceiro tiro assassina — porque outro porque quero outroessa justiça vela sono repudio humilhada precisar enquanto durmo falsamente salvo sonsos essenciais casa funcione exijo mim primeiro dever sonsa exerça revolta amor guardados sonsa casa estremece devo ter esquecido embaixo casa terreno chão onde nova casa poderia erguida enquanto dormimos falsamente salvamos treze tiro acordam horror digo tarde demais – vinte oito ano mineirinho nasceu – homem acuado matem porque sei erro vida inteira deus salva vezes apenas erro sei salvaremos enquanto erro precioso erro espelho onde vejo silêncio fiz homem erro modo vi vida abrir carne espantei vi matéria vida placenta sangue lama viva mineirinho rebentou modo viverclarice lispector esquecer 19991 facínora dizse indivíduo executa crime crueldade perversidade acentuada2 mineirinho apelido conhecido criminoso carioca josé miranda rosa acuado polícia acabou crivado balas corpo leia texto responder questões 33 37nobel winner malala open school syrian refugeessylvia westalljuly 13 2015bekaa valley lebanonnobel peace prize laureate malala yousafzai gesture insidea classroom at school syrian refugee girlsjuly 12 2015 reutersjamal saidimalala yousafzai the youngest winner of the nobel peace prize celebrated her 18th birthday in lebanon on sunday by opening school syrian refugee girl and called on world leader to invest in “ book not bullet ” malala became symbol of defiance after she wa shot on school bus in pakistan in 2012 by the taliban advocating girl ’ right to education she continued campaigning and won the nobel in 2014 “ i decided to be in lebanon because i believe that the voice of the syrian refugee need to be heard and they have been ignored so long ” malala told reuters in schoolroom decorated with drawing of butterfly the malala fund nonprofit organization that support local education project provided most of the funding the school set up by lebanon ’ s kayany foundation in the bekaa valley close to the syrian border the kayany foundation established by syrian nora joumblatt in response to syria ’ s refugee crisis ha already completed three other new school to give free education to syrian child in lebanon the malala school can welcome up to 200 girl aged 14 to 18 “ today on my first day an adult on behalf of the world ’ s child i demand of leader we must invest in book instead of bullet ” malala said in speech lebanon is home to at least 12 million of the 4 million refugee that have fled syria ’ s war to neighboring country there are about 500000 syrian schoolage child in lebanon but only fifth are in formal education “ we are in danger of losing generation of young syrian girl due to the lack of education ” joumblatt said in speech at the opening of the school “ desperate and displaced syrian are increasingly seeing early marriage way to secure the social and financial future of their daughter we need to provide an alternative keep young girl in school instead of being pressured into wedlock ” lebanon which allows informal settlement on land rented by refugee say it can longer cope with the influx from syria ’ s fouryear conflict more than one in four people living in lebanon is refugee the united nation say the number of syrian refugee in neighboring country is expected to reach 427 million by the end of the year “ in lebanon well in jordan an increasing number of refugee are being turned back at the border ” malala said “ this is inhuman and this is shameful ” her father ziauddin said he wa proud she wa carrying on her activism into adulthood “ this is the mission we have taken the last 89 year small moment the education of girl in swat valley it is spreading now all over the world ” he saidwwwreuterscom adaptadoaccording to the text malala yousafzai wa shot because she

leia texto responder questões 38 45poverty may hinder kid ’ brain development study saysreduced gray matter lower test score reported poor childrenjuly 20 2015poverty appears to affect the brain development of child hampering the growth of gray matter and impairing their academic performance researcher report poor child tend to have much 10 percent le gray matter in several area of the brain associated with academic skill according to study published july 20 in jama pediatrics “ we used to think of poverty ‘ social ’ issue but what we are learning now is that it is biomedical issue that is affecting brain growth ” said senior study author seth pollak professor of psychology pediatrics anthropology and neuroscience at the university of wisconsinmadisonthe result could have profound implication the united state where lowincome student now represent the majority of kid in public school the study author said in background information fiftyone percent of public school student came from lowincome family in 2013previous study have shown that child living in poverty tend to perform poorly in school the author say they have markedly lower test score and not go far in school their welloff peersto see whether this is due to some physical effect that poverty might have on child ’ s brain pollak and his colleague analyzed mri scan of 389 typically developing kid aged 4 to 22 assessing the amount of gray matter in the whole brain well the frontal lobe temporal lobe and hippocampus “ gray matter contains most of the brain ’ s neuronal cell ” pollak said “ in other word other part of the brain – like white matter – carry information from one section of the brain to another but the gray matter is where seeing and hearing memory emotion speech decision making and selfcontrol occur ” child living below 150 percent of the federal poverty level – u 36375 family of four – had 3 percent to 4 percent le gray matter in important region of their brain compared to the norm the author found those in family living below the federal poverty level fared even worse with 8 percent to 10 percent le gray matter in those same brain region the federal poverty level in 2015 is u 24250 family of four these same kid scored an average of four to seven point lower on standardized test the researcher saidthe team estimated that much 20 percent of the gap in test score could be explained by reduced brain development host of povertyrelated issue likely contribute to developmental lag in child ’ s brain pollak said lowincome kid are le likely to get the type of stimulation from their parent and environment that help the brain grow he said example they hear fewer new word and have fewer opportunity to read or play game their brain development also can be affected by factor related to impoverishment such high stress level poor sleep crowding and poor nutrition pollak saidthis study serf call to action given what ’ s already known about the effect of poverty on child development said dr joan luby professor of child psychiatry at washington university school of medicine in st louis “ the thing that ’ s really important about this study in the context of the broader literature is that there really is enough scientific evidence to take public health action at this point ” said luby who wrote an editorial accompanying the study “ poverty negatively affect brain development and we also know that early intervention are powerfully effective ” luby said “ they are more effective than intervention later in life and they also are costeffective ” wwwnlmnihgov adaptadono trecho quarto parágrafo “ to see whether this is due to some physical effect that poverty might have on child ’ s brain ” expressão destaque introduz

some of the impact of climate change such more extreme weather and rising sea scientist said on thursdayup to 14 of emission from agriculture in 2050 couldbe avoided by managing food use and distribution betteraccording to new study from the potsdam institute climate impact research pik “ agriculture is majordriver of climate change accounting more than 20of overall global greenhouse gas emission in 2010 ” said coauthor prajal pradhan “ avoiding food loss and waste would therefore avoid unnecessary greenhouse gas emission and help mitigate climate change ” between 30 and 40 of food produced around the worldis never eaten because it is spoiled after harvest and during transportation or thrown away by shop and consumer the share of food wasted is expected to increase drastically if emerging economy like china and india adopt western food habit including shift to eating more meat there searcher warned richer country tend to consume morefood than is healthy or simply waste it they notedas poorer country develop and the world ’ s population grows emission associated with food waste could soar from 05 gigatonnes gt of carbon dioxide equivalent per year to between 19 and 25 gt annually by midcentury showed the study published in the environmental science amp technology journal it is widely argued that cutting food waste and distributing the world ’ s surplus food where it is needed could help tackle hunger in place that not have enough – especially given that land to expand farming is limitedbut jürgen kropp another of the study ’ s coauthor and pik ’ s head of climate change and development told the thomson reuters foundation the potential food wastecurbs to reduce emission should be given more attention “ it is not strategy of government at the moment ” he world of address book street atlas and phone box seems very far away lost in the mist of time following there are just some of the big milestone from the past 30 year that have made almost everything we easier more public and very very fast• the first phone arrive – and become status symbolsfew people got the chance to use the very early mobile phone the first call wa made in new york in 1973 but handset with network to use were not available until 1983 in the u and 1985 in the uk that first british mobile phone wa essentially heavy briefcase with receiver attached by wire it cost £2000 £5000 in today ’ s price and gave you half an hour ’ s chat on an overnight charge making call wa not something you could subtly but that wasn ’ t the point the first handset were there to be seen they sent message that you were bold and confident with new technology that you were busy and important enough to need mobile phone and were rich enough to buy one• text message spawn whole new languagethe first mobile worked with analogue signal and could only make phone call but the digital one that followed in the early 1990s could send sm message well after the first message wa sent on 3 december 1992 texting took off like rocket even though it wa still pretty cumbersome procedure handset with predictive text would make thing easier but in the 1990s you could save lot of time by removing all excess letter from message often the vowel and so txtspk w brn today the average mobile phone sends more than 100 text per month• phone turn u all into photographersthere seemed to be good reason the first camera phone which began to appear in 2002 with resolution of about 03 megapixels they took grainy blurry picture on postage stampsized screen and even these filled the phone ’ s memory in time gradually though the quality improved the us followed well the usual photo of friend and family they were handy “ saving ” piece of paper and in pub you could take picture of the special board and take it back to your table modern camera phone have changed beyond recognition in the past 20 year the new mobile phone boast the highest resolution dual camera on smartphone 16 megapixel camera and 20megapixel camera sidebyside the dual camera allows user to focus on their subject while blurring out the background producing professionallooking portraits• …and we turn ourselves into celebritiestwenty year ago people would have thought you little strange if you took flattering photo of yourself and your lifestyle and then distributed them to your friend – let alone to member of the public if you used printed photograph rather than smartphone app they would still think so today yet sharing our life on social medium is now the norm not the exception – and it wa the camera phone that made it all possible now some phone come with an enormous 64gb of memory so you can capture share and store an almost countless number of video and picture – well certainly enough to keep up with the kardashianswwwtheguardiancom 07072017 adaptadothe mobile phone connected to network were first accessible

normalmente noturno tanto pode evocar prazer quanto medo justamente palavra usada designar tudo quer tero repertório publicitário contemporâneo dúvidas sonho força motriz comportamentos desejo indústria saúde sono setor cresce aceleradamente valor estimado 30 bilhões 40 bilhões dólares assim insônia impera tempo sempre escasso despertamos diariamente toque insistente despertador ainda sonolentos atrasados cumprir compromissos renovam infinito tão poucos lembram sonham simple falta oportunidade contemplar vida interior insônia grassa bocejo impõe chegase duvidar sobrevivência sonhoe entanto sonhase sonhase granel sonhase sofregamente apesar luzes ruídos cidade incessante faina vida tristeza perspectivas dirá formiga cética sonha assim tão livre artista cigarra fábula vive brisa padrão racionalidade devoção bem comum virtude cívica postulado filósofos século xviii políticos – escreveu – representam natureza humana defeitos qualidades menos wallas primeiro destacar fosso abrira política real desenrola parlamento noutros órgãos estado percepção parte opinião pública fato iluminismo criara noção psicologicamente superficial cidadão filosofante nada ver cidadãos carne osso reflexões realistas sobre tal discrepância demoraram aparecer wallas tendo sido pioneira instigantes hoje sabemos fenômeno descrito wallas especificamente inglês passageiro apareceu reação disfunções características estágios iniciais democracia representativa questionamentos semelhantes continuam manifestar toda parte duas vertentes nitidamente diferenciadas notou referente atitudes cidadão comum relação funcionamento instituições sobretudo legislativos partidos políticos outra propriamente filosófica refere ideologia liberal mundo modernoo azedume primeira vertente sido regularmente pesquisado entidades acadêmicas todo mundo difícil dizer existe consenso quanto causa formas características antídotos administrados eficácia duvidosa têm sido basicamente reformas institucionais concentrandose principalmente sistemas partidários eleitorais tudo faz crer cidadão comum quer ordem quer estado capaz mantêla deseja diluição destruição poder menos experiências anar quistas tresloucadas despreza “ política ” sentido comumente atribuído termo hesitaria acabar soubesse fazêlo valoriza finalidade última estado abomina meio atua sistema político raiz desse sentimento parece fator psicológico – desconforto cidadão comum diante certas exterioridades política cujas funções chega compreender bem luta políticos controle partidos chapas eleitorais labirinto táticas combate parlamentar retórica quase sempre entediante caráter vago francamente inexequível maioria promessas feitas durante campanhas outras segunda vertente nutrese ideias filosóficas estéticas leia crônica “ premonitório ” carlos drummond andrade 19021987 responder questões 01 09do fundo pernambuco pai mandoulhe telegrama “ saia casa 3 outubro abraços ” rapaz releu sob emoção grave ainda bem velho avisara cima hora avisara olhou data 28 setembro puxa vida telegrama nota urgente levar cinco dia garanhuns belo horizonte revolução telégrafo endireita passado sete manhã veja pai tomara mingau broa precipitarase agência expedir mensagemnão havia tempo perder marcara encontros dia seguinte precisava cancelar tudo alarde deve agir tai ocasiões pegou telefone pediu linha voz d anita respondeu havia tempo morava naquele hotel jamais deixara ouvir “ poi ” melodioso d anita durante dia voz grossa resmungara qualquer coisa empregado casa insistira “ ” ligação dificultosa havia besouros linha falou rapidamente diversas pessoas aludiu ponte talvez resistisse ainda un dia oportunidade escandir sílabas arma virumque cano1 disse achava pouco cem mil unidades tal emergência arrematou “ dia 4 conversamos ” vestiuse desceu portaria sujeito panamá bege chapéu aba larga sapato duas core levantouse seguiuo tomou carro outro fez desceu praça liberdade pôsse contemplar ponto qualquer tirou bolso caderninho anotou qualquer coisa aí havia doi sujeitos panamá aba larga sapato bicolor confabulando pequena distância saindo mansinho doi seguiram cola calmo telegrama pai dobrado carteira placidez satisfeita alma pai avisara tempo tudo correria bem ia tomar calçada baioneta riste advertiu “ passe largo ” delegacia fiscal cercada praças havia armas cruzadas canto correios mesma coisa telefônica bondes passavam escoltados caminhões conduziam tropa jipes chispavam manchetes jornais sombrias pouca gente rua céu escuro abafado chuva próximapensando bem melhor recolherse hotel havia nada fazer trancouse quarto procurou ler vez telefone chamava “ desculpe engano ” ficava mudo desligar dizendose incomodado jantou quarto estranhou camareiraque olhava móveis bichos deliberou deitarse embora noite apenas começasse releu telegrama apagou luzacordou assustado golpes porta cinco manhã alguém convidava ir delegacia ordem política social “ deve engano ” “ chefe espera ” “ tão leia texto responder questões 21 28your screen freeze there ’ s weird echo dozen head stare at you there are the work huddle the oneonone meeting and then once you ’ re done the day the hangout with friend and family since the covid19 pandemic hit we ’ re on video call more than ever before – and many are finding it exhaustingbeing on video call requires more focus than face toface chat say gianpetro petriglier who study sustainable development in the workplace video chat mean we need to work harder to process nonverbal cue like facial expression the tone and pitch of the voice and body language “ our mind are together when our body feel we ’ re not and that dissonance tire u out ” he sayssilence is another challenge he add “ silence creates natural rhythm in reallife conversation however when it happens in video call you become anxious about the technology ” one 2014 study by german academic showed that delay on phone or conferencing system shaped our view of people negatively even delay of 12 second made people perceive the responder le friendly or focusedour presentday circumstance – whether quarantine working from home or otherwise – are also feeding in aspect of our life that used to be separate – work school friend family – are all happening in the same space individual have multiple aspect – context dependent social role relationship activity and goal – and we the key trend that will shape renewable energy in 2018 and beyonda man clean solar panel installed on his rooftop free by the government in china image reutersstringer 12 janwhen clean energy first made headway in the global scenario question were raised about how stable and scalable it wa at macro level unstable policy powering future growth were exacerbated by technological funding nevertheless clean energy installation continued to grow albeit slowly until dramatic leap few year agoan unprecedented drop in the cost of producing clean energy ha occurred in the last couple of year it is becoming the cheapest source of power more and more countriesthese heady decline in cost are likely to continue over the next decadegiven it increasing affordability the application and use case of renewable energy have broadened alongside electricity production it is providing new solution mobility and energy security worldwidethe electric vehicle market is growing rapidly with china leading the way and european and american market following suit country like india are already targeting complete electrification of it vehicular fleet by 2030 the affordability and widespread use of electric vehicle is being driven in part by falling battery cost these enable further energy stability solution including windsolar hybrid generationtoday fifth of the world ’ s electricity is produced by renewable energy in 2016 there were 160gw of clean energy installation globally this is 10 more than in 2015 but they cost almost quarter le new solar power gave the biggest boost providing half of all new capacity followed by wind power which provided third and hydropower which gave 15 it wa the first year in history that added solar capacity outstripped any other electricityproducing technologycareful protectionism or liberalisation of the renewables sector – according to each country ’ s requirement – is necessary so not to harm sector growth in the long run there must be balance between fair competition on the one hand and incentive company to focus on development on the other hand while gaining good return on their investment government must and manufacturing commitment that support clean energyrenewable energy is global phenomenon on the upswing the foreseeable future it growth is set to accelerate but we have to ensure that progress is made in the right way our priority and decision now will determine how future society benefitfonte lthttpshttpswwwweforumorgagenda201801cleanenergyrenewablegrowthsustainablekeytrends adaptadoit is correct to state according to the second paragraph
