leia textoyour screen freeze there ’ s weird echo dozen head stare at you there are the work huddle the oneonone meeting and then once you ’ re done the day the hangout with friend and family since the covid19 pandemic hit we ’ re on video call more than ever before – and many are finding it exhaustingbeing on video call requires more focus than face toface chat say gianpetro petriglier who study sustainable development in the workplace video chat mean we need to work harder to process nonverbal cue like facial expression the tone and pitch of the voice and body language “ our mind are together when our body feel we ’ re not and that dissonance tire u out ” he sayssilence is another challenge he add “ silence creates natural rhythm in reallife conversation however when it happens in video call you become anxious about the technology ” one 2014 study by german academic showed that delay on phone or conferencing system shaped our view of people negatively even delay of 12 second made people perceive the responder le friendly or focusedour presentday circumstance – whether quarantine working from home or otherwise – are also feeding in aspect of our life that used to be separate – work school friend family – are all happening in the same space individual have multiple aspect – context dependent social role relationship activity and goal – and we find the variety healthy say petriglieri when these aspect are reduced we become more vulnerable to negative feelingsa lack of downtime after we ’ ve fulfilled some work or family commitment may be another factor in our tiredness while some of u may be putting higher expectation on ourselves due to worry over the economy or job loss “ there ’ s also that heightened sense of ‘ i need to be performing at my top level in situation ’ … some of u are kind of overperforming to secure our job ” lot of u are doing big group chat the first time whether it ’ s cooking and eating virtual dinner attending university catchup or holding birthday party friend if the call is meant to be fun why might it feel tiring part of it is whether you ’ re joining in because you want to or because you feel you ought to if you see it an obligation that mean more time that you ’ re ‘ on ’ opposed to getting breakexperts ’ suggestion zoom1 fatigue limiting video call to those that are necessary considering if video chat are really the most efficient option and maybe say petriglieri if you want to reach out go old school “ write letter to someone instead of meeting them on zoom tell them you really care about them ” manyu jiang disponível wwwbbccom 22abr2020 adaptadono trecho terceiro parágrafo “ however when ithappens in video call ” palavra sublinhada pode sersubstituída alteração sentido

texto seguir servirá base realização nove questões objetivas língua portuguesa redaçãotecnologia pode tirar ciências humanas idade média diz pierre lévyraphael hernandesfolha spaulo 10 setembro 2019 caderno ilustrada p c6são paulo – pierre lévy 63 começou escrever sobre cibercultura internet mato filósofo pioneiros tratar relação sociedade computador ciências humanas precisam passar revolução passaram naturais tecnologia chave atingir “ patamar mínimo ” “ humanidades ainda idade média ” “ vez desenvolver máquinas inteligentes deveríamos usar computadores tornar inteligentes ” diz filósofo quer reorganizar conhecimento trabalha linguagem faria humanos conversarem máquinas intermédio programação 2020 deve lançar livro explicando gramática dessa língua data editora definidoslévy nasceu tunísia desenvolveu carreira frança falou folha ante vir brasil onde participa fronteiras pensamento salvador nesta terçafeira 10 ingressos esgotados• pergunta 1 vivemos mundo conectado muda sociedadea chegada computadores pessoais internet smartphone aí vai transformam sistema comunicação sociedadeem novo sistema comunicação toda informação acessível onipresente pessoas interconectadas ainda importante robôs capazes automaticamente transformar símbolos fazer traduções cálculos estatísticos novo aconteceu apenas 20 30 ano difícil pensar implicações dessa mudança comunicação começo dessa nova civilização• pergunta 2 inteligência coletivaé algo velho ante espécie humana abelhas acumulam mel si comunidade formigas conseguem sinalizar onde coisas boa comer comunicação coordenação colaboração animais sociais frequente ainda forte mamíferos primatas inteligência coletiva algo outros animais têm linguagemela permite acumulemos conhecimento geração geração serve criar nova formas coordenar cooperar complexas mundo animalcada vez capazes fortalecer habilidade linguística agora comunicação digital aumentamos inteligência coletivaé quase oposto inteligência artificial contra objetivo geral deveria inteligência coletivahá muita memória comum disposição podemos aumentála conteúdo disponível digitalmente podemos aumentar habilidade coordenar colaborar exemplo uso redes sociais público geral empresas governos• pergunta 3 inteligência coletiva amarrada interneta biblioteca forma antiga memória coletiva internet nova forma vez ter palavras escritas papel códigos totalmente materiais têm computador algum lugar falta habilidade educação tirar melhor disso• pergunta 4 tirar melhor dessas possibilidadesvocê aprender controlar gerenciar atenção precisa poder categorizar dado corretamente avaliar confiança pode dar fontes informação capaz comparar diferentes fontes aprender comportar inteligência coletiva trabalhar outros fim transformar todos dado conhecimento• pergunta 5 onde entra big dataé nova forma memória hoje toda realidade representada mar dado tudo gera dado agora problema faremos extraímos conhecimento útil delese toda metodologia científica jogo aqui acho estatística sozinha gente precise precisamos categorizar todos dado hipóteses modelos causais estatística testar hipótesesé reprodução método científico todos começo transformação dado conhecimento• pergunta 6 onde linguagem artificial ieml sigla inglês metalinguagem economia informação encaixaieml língua característica ter semântica computável ter significado unívocohoje algoritmos capazes entender linguagem natural cálculos estatísticos ieml significado acessível pode usado sistema semântico universal faria análise big data extração conhecimento dado fácil dado categorizados linguagem natural porque línguas naturais irregulares diversas• pergunta 7 linguagem fazer conexão humanos máquinasexatamente criada linguagem máquinas podem entender pode traduzida línguas naturais humanos entendam diferente linguagem programaçãoa grande revolução científica frente ciências humanas fizemos revolução ciências naturais humanidades idade média meio uso dado disponíveis todo poder computacional usando ferramentas ieml categorizar dado expressar fatos teorias forma rigorosa poderíamos alcançar patamar mínimo tratamento científico humanidades• pergunta 8 sr vê futuro dessa sociedade digital conectadaduas coisas vão acontecer primeiro todo problema resolvido tecnologia nunca vai acontecer sempre vão surgir novos problemas segunda robôs vão assumir poder simplesmente impossível civilização vai evoluir forma difícil preveradaptadoao final resposta lévy segunda pergunta colchetes empregados finalidade

perdizes três tatu paca muita caça menor leão sentouse tronco voz tonitruante procurava inutilmente suavizar berrou— bem agora terminamos magnífico dia trabalho descansemos aqui camaradas justa partilha esforço conjunto compadre burro favor sábio três licença compadre rato compadre burro vai fazer partilha desta caça três partes absolutamente iguais vamos compadre rato rio beber pouco água deixando grande amigo burro paz deliberaros doi afastaram rio beberam água2 ficaram tempo voltaram verificaram burro feito trabalho extremamente meticuloso dividindo caça três partes absolutamente iguais assim viu doi voltando burro perguntou leão— pronto compadre leão aí acha partilhao leão disse palavra deu violenta patada nuca burro prostrandoo chão mortosorrindo leão voltouse rato disse— compadre rato lamento impressão concorda podíamos suportar presença tamanha inaptidão burrice desculpe ter perdido paciência havia outra coisa fazer suportava compadre burro faça favor agora — divida bolo caça incluindo favor corpo compadre burro vou rio novamente deixandolhe calma deliberação sensatamal leão afastou rato menor dúvida dividiu monte caça doi lado toda caça inclusive corpo burro outro apenas ratinho cinza morto acaso leão ainda chegado rio rato chamou— compadre leão pronta partilhao leão vendo caça dividida maneira tão justa pôde deixar cumprimentar rato— maravilhoso caro compadre maravilhoso chegou tão depressa partilha tão certae rato respondeu— simple estabeleci relação matemática tamanho — claro precisa comer tracei comparação força — claro precisa maior volume alimentação comparei ponderadamente posição floresta — evidentemente partilha podium além intelectual todo espírito— inacreditável inacreditável compreensão argúcia — exclamou leão realmente admirado — olha juro nunca notado cultura escondeu tempo todo ensinou tanta sabedoria— verdade leão nunca soube nada perdoa elogio fúnebre ofende acabei aprender tudo agora burro mortomoral burro tenta ficar leia texto responder questões 11 20breaking down barriersshuffling foot and the general buzz of conversation made lecture trial gemma long during her first degree she suffers from sensory overload connected to her autism which wa only diagnosed after she graduated but when she started teachertraining course year later she received access to software to help her cope with dyslexia and found it transformative “ i struggled to understand the point of lecture until i got that software ” recall long “ i didn ’ t realise how much useful information wa in them someone who is hypersensitive to noise i spend most of my time in lecture trying to filter out the background noise which mean i miss much of what the lecturer is saying being able to audio record the lecture and listen back to them in silent room meant i wa finally able to digest the content ” technology is breaking down barrier faced by student with disability online journal article now mean that those with visual impairment can zoom in to read printed text or convert it to easiertoread format such braille university are also increasingly recording lecture which student can replay at their own pace which benefit student with dyslexia or attention deficit disorder tooaccording to alistair mcnaught digital learning consultant university are increasingly tracking how student learn and then directing them to the accessible resource most suited to their personal need mcnaught appreciates the way assistive technology can help all student — whether they have disability or not — but stress that it ’ s important university to get the basic right first “ many higher and further institution have inaccessible website or inaccessible digital content if the content is inaccessible investment in assistive technology can be undermined at stroke ” “ university just need to get better at promoting the support that ’ s already there ” say gemma long “ making specialist software and training generally available rather than confining it to disabled student make it more widely known well remove stigma ” someone like her who received her diagnosis late it would have been particularly helpful to this end the assistive technology network she founded to represent staff who support their disabled student with tech will hold it first award ceremony next monthuniversities are slowly tackling the barrier disabled student there ’ s more yet to come the prospect of virtual reality – particularly when it come to fieldwork “ it can be incredibly difficult disabled student to get wheelchair on to salt marsh ” say pier wilkinson researcher in the area “ but if the learning aim are being immersed in an environment and making discovery virtual reality an achieve that ” wwwtheguardiancom 03062019 sabem defender voz parece encontrar solução javé precisa reconhecida “ patrimônio ” poi assim tornaria cidade submersa duas dimensões dessa fala merecem assinaladas “ patrimônio ” aparece recurso reivindicação palavra enuncia naquela específica cena evidencia quanto deixou termo técnico especializado vinculado saber política formal tornar lugarcomum metáfora poderosa submersão equivale esque cimento reconhecimento reivin dicação posse patrimônio demanda visibilidade desprovidos recursos materiais pudessem considerados valor histórico narradores javé podem recordar reinventar histórias mito fundação patrimônio hoje chamamos imaterial intangível termo “ patrimônio ” latim pater pai tornouse corriqueiro adjetivação espraiou patrimônio pode histórico ambiental arqueológico artístico material imaterial etc qualificações comumente subsumidas sob guardachuva “ cultural ” remissão pai patriarca conduz legado herança − acaso termo inglês exatamente heritage filme citado bastava reconhecer algo importante preciso escrever anotar identificar – passar adiante conjunto práticas pode transmutar relatos estórias passadas conversas informais costume “ patrimônio ” − cidade grupo região nação patrimônio representação coletiva outra qualquer sim prática constituída processo atribuição valor deve reconhecido grupo disposto conserválo outras palavras patrimônio histórico remete políticas públicas ações têm lugar esfera pública grupos sociais atribuem valores distintos ben materiais memórias marcas territoriais nomeiam − desse modo distinguem classificam − ambiente rodeia destacam passagens história comum passado coletivo elegem paisagens falamos patrimônio histórico cultural etc disso trata conjunto ben materiais imateriais fruto decisão partiu identificação algo letterschildren and gunspublished may 7 2013to the editor re “ girl ’ s death by gunshot is rejected symbol ” new article may 6i find it abhorrent that the people of burkesville ky are not willing to learn lesson from the tragic shooting of 2yearold girl by her 5yearold brother i am not judging their lifestyle of introducing gun to child at young age but i feel that it ’ s irresponsible not to practice basic safety with anything potentially lethal – gun knife fire and so on how can anyone justify leaving gun lying around unlocked and possibly loaded in home with two young child i wish the family of the victim comfort during this difficult time but to dismiss this simple accident leaf open the potential many more such “ accident ” to occur i hope this doesn ’ t have to happen several more time legislator to realize that something need to be changedemily loubatonbrooklyn may 6 2013disponível wwwnytimescom acesso 10 maio 2013no diz respeito tragédia ocorrida burkesville autora carta enviada the new york time busca

atenção questões números 1 11 referemse texto segueno livro human nature in politics publicado 1908 deputado inglês graham wallas criticou tendência época difundida imaginar políticos pudessem encarnar padrão racionalidade devoção bem comum virtude cívica postulado filósofos século xviii políticos – escreveu – representam natureza humana defeitos qualidades menoswallas primeiro destacar fosso abrira política real desenrola parlamento noutros órgãos estado percepção parte opinião pública fato iluminismo criara noção psicologicamente superficial cidadão filosofante nada ver cidadãos carne osso reflexões realistas sobre tal discrepância demoraram aparecer wallas tendo sido pioneira instiganteshoje sabemos fenômeno descrito wallas especificamente inglês passageiro apareceu reação institucionais concentrandose principalmente sistemas partidários eleitorais tudo faz crer cidadão comum quer ordem quer estado capaz mantêla deseja diluição destruição poder menos experiências anar quistas tresloucadas despreza “ política ” sentido comumente atribuído termo hesitaria acabar soubesse fazêlo valoriza finalidade última estado abomina meio atua sistema políticona raiz desse atenção questões números 1 11 referemse texto segueno livro human nature in politics publicado 1908 deputado inglês graham wallas criticou tendência época difundida imaginar políticos pudessem encarnar padrão racionalidade devoção bem comum virtude cívica postulado filósofos século xviii políticos – escreveu – representam natureza humana defeitos qualidades menoswallas primeiro destacar fosso abrira política real desenrola parlamento noutros órgãos estado percepção parte opinião pública fato iluminismo criara noção psicologicamente superficial cidadão filosofante nada ver cidadãos carne osso reflexões realistas sobre tal discrepância demoraram aparecer wallas tendo sido pioneira instiganteshoje sabemos fenômeno descrito wallas especificamente inglês passageiro apareceu reação disfunções características estágios iniciais democracia representativa questionamentos semelhantes continuam manifestar toda parte duas vertentes nitidamente diferenciadas notou referente atitudes cidadão comum relação funcionamento instituições sobretudo legislativos partidos políticos outra propriamente filosófica refere ideologia liberal mundo modernoo azedume primeira vertente sido regularmente pesquisado entidades acadêmicas todo mundo difícil dizer existe consenso quanto causa formas características antídotos administrados eficácia duvidosa têm sido basicamente reformas institucionais concentrandose principalmente sistemas partidários eleitorais tudo faz crer cidadão comum quer ordem quer estado capaz mantêla deseja diluição destruição poder menos experiências anar quistas tresloucadas despreza “ política ” sentido comumente atribuído termo hesitaria acabar soubesse fazêlo valoriza finalidade última estado abomina meio atua sistema políticona raiz desse sentimento parece fator psicológico – desconforto cidadão comum diante certas exterioridades política cujas funções chega compreender bem luta políticos controle partidos chapas elei torais labirinto táticas combate parlamentar retórica quase sempre entediante caráter vago francamente inexequível maioria promessas feitas durante campanhas outrasa segunda vertente nutrese ideias filosóficas estéticas abrangentes radicais formouse bojo grandes transformações lugar europa desde século xviii base materiais sociedade revolução industrial conflito class esfera estado direito transição absolutismo estado constitucional plano cultura arte chamada “ idade ideologia ” advento romantismo sob decisivo influxo obra jeanjacques rousseaulamounier bolivar liberais antiliberais luta ideológica tempo paulo companhia letras 2016 p 15 17é correto comentário faz sobre palavra indicada

consider how inclined people are to ‘ couple ’ or ‘ decouple ’ topic involving wider political and social factor swedish data analyst john nerst ha used the term to describe the contrasting way in which people approach contentious issue those of u more inclined to ‘ couple ’ see them inextricably related to broader matrix of factor whereas those more predisposed to ‘ decouple ’ prefer to consider an issue in isolation to take crude example decoupler might consider in isolation the question of whether vaccine provides degree of immunity to virus coupler by contrast would immediately see the issue inextricably entangled in mesh of factor such pharmaceutical industry power and parental choice2 most of u are deeply committed to our belief especially concerning moral and social issue such that when we ’ re presented with fact that contradict our belief we often choose to dismiss those fact rather than update our beliefsa study at arizona state university u analysed more than 100000 comment on forum where user post their view on an issue and invite others to persuade them to change their mind the researcher found that regardless of the kind of topic people were more likely to change their mind when confronted with more evidence based argument “ our work may suggest that while attitude change is hardwon providing fact statistic and citation one ’ s argument can convince people to change their mind ” they concluded3 just be nicerfinally it ’ s easier said than done but let ’ s all try to be more respectful of and attentive to each other ’ s position we should this not just virtuous reason but because the more we create that kind of climate the more openminded and intellectually flexible we will all be inclined to be and then hopefully collectively we can start having more constructive disagreement — even in our present very difficult timeschristian jarrett wwwbbccom 14102020 adaptadothe subtitle that most closely represents the content of the fifth and sixth paragraph is

el virus del papiloma humano hpvtambiém e un problema hombrespara algunos hombre el virus del papiloma humano hpv e algo muy lejano olvidan ellos tambén infectan y al contagiarmos están regalando un pasaporte mágico el cáncer cérvico uterino – segunda causa muerte la mujeres méxico – incluso ha tocado escuchar en boca algunos ellos “ sólo trata una infeccioncita ” pues bien el hpv tambén e un problema hombre sólo porque propaga la infección la población femenina sino también porque virus produce otros problemas salud tanto en hombre en mujeres incluyendo verrugas genitales y cáncer boca y garganta si bien son tan conocidos alarmantes su cantidad otros tipos cáncer tambén constituyen un riesgo lo anterior la academia americana pediatría decidió enfrentarse al hpv mediante vacunas ponen tanto mujeres hombre los especialistas afirman la vacuna e más efectiva si administra ante el niño vuelva sexualmente activo y responde mejor en el organismo varones 9 y15 añosalbiter k disponível httpvivirmexicocomacesso 10 jul 1012 adaptadoo texto aborda temática hpv discorrer sobre contágio prevenção papiloma humano autora informa leitores vírus

leia textoyour screen freeze there ’ s weird echo dozen head stare at you there are the work huddle the oneonone meeting and then once you ’ re done the day the hangout with friend and family since the covid19 pandemic hit we ’ re on video call more than ever before – and many are finding it exhaustingbeing on video call requires more focus than face toface chat say gianpetro petriglier who study sustainable development in the workplace video chat mean we need to work harder to process nonverbal cue like facial expression the tone and pitch of the voice and body language “ our mind are together when our body feel we ’ re not and that dissonance tire u out ” he sayssilence is another challenge he add “ silence creates natural rhythm in reallife conversation however when it happens in video call you become anxious about the technology ” one 2014 study by german academic showed that delay on phone or conferencing system shaped our view of people negatively even delay of 12 second made people perceive the responder le friendly or focusedour presentday circumstance – whether quarantine working from home or otherwise – are also feeding in aspect of our life that used to be separate – work school friend family – are all happening in the same space individual have multiple aspect – context dependent social role relationship activity and goal – and we find the variety healthy say petriglieri when these aspect are reduced we become more vulnerable to negative feelingsa lack of downtime after we ’ ve fulfilled some work or family commitment may be another factor in our tiredness while some of u may be putting higher expectation on ourselves due to worry over the economy or job loss “ there ’ s also that heightened sense of ‘ i need to be performing at my top level in situation ’ … some of u are kind of overperforming to secure our job ” lot of u are doing big group chat the first time whether it ’ s cooking and eating virtual dinner attending university catchup or holding birthday party friend if the call is meant to be fun why might it feel tiring part of it is whether you ’ re joining in because you want to or because you feel you ought to if you see it an obligation that mean more time that you ’ re ‘ on ’ opposed to getting breakexperts ’ suggestion zoom1 fatigue limiting video call to those that are necessary considering if video chat are really the most efficient option and maybe say petriglieri if you want to reach out go old school “ write letter to someone instead of meeting them on zoom tell them you really care about them ” manyu remember the good old day when you could have heatedyetenjoyable debate with your friend about thing that didn ’ t matter that much — time when you could be true fan of the manchester united soccer team when you didn ’ t come from the city of manchesterhow thing have changednow disagreement feel deadly serious like when your colleague pronounces that wearing face mask in public is threat to his liberty or when you see that one of your friend ha just tweeted that actually all life matter before you know it you ’ re feeling angry and forming harsh new judgment about your colleague and friend let ’ s take collective pause and breathe there are some way we can all try to have more civil disagreement in this febrile age of culture wars1 ‘ coupling ’ and ‘ decoupling ’ the first is to consider how inclined people are to ‘ couple ’ or ‘ decouple ’ topic involving wider political and social factor swedish data analyst john nerst ha used the term to describe the contrasting way in which people approach contentious issue those of u more inclined to ‘ couple ’ see them inextricably related to broader matrix of factor whereas those more predisposed to ‘ decouple ’ prefer to consider an issue in isolation to take crude example decoupler might consider in isolation the question of whether vaccine provides degree of immunity to virus coupler by contrast would immediately see the issue inextricably entangled in mesh of factor such pharmaceutical industry power and parental choice2 most of u are deeply committed to our belief especially concerning moral and social issue such that when we ’ re presented with fact that contradict our belief we often choose to dismiss those fact rather than update our beliefsa study at arizona state university u analysed more than 100000 comment on forum where user post their view on an issue and invite others to persuade them to change their mind the researcher found that regardless of the kind of topic people were more likely to change their mind when confronted with more evidence based argument “ our work may suggest that while attitude change is hardwon providing fact statistic and citation one ’ s argument can convince people to change their mind ” they concluded3 just be nicerfinally it ’ s easier said than done but let ’ s all try to be more respectful of and attentive to each other ’ s position we should this not just virtuous reason but because the more we create that kind of climate the more openminded and intellectually flexible we will all be inclined to be and then hopefully collectively we can start having more constructive disagreement — even in our present very difficult timeschristian jarrett wwwbbccom 14102020 adaptadothe expression “ before you know it ” 3rd paragraph can be correctly interpreted

atenção questões números 1 11 referemse texto segue livro human nature in politics publicado 1908 deputado inglês graham wallas criticou tendência época difundida imaginar políticos pudessem encarnar padrão racionalidade devoção bem comum virtude cívica postulado filósofos século xviii políticos – escreveu – representam natureza humana defeitos qualidades menos wallas primeiro destacar fosso abrira política real desenrola parlamento noutros órgãos estado percepção parte opinião pública fato iluminismo criara noção psicologicamente superficial cidadão filosofante nada ver cidadãos carne osso reflexões realistas sobre tal discrepância demoraram aparecer wallas tendo sido pioneira instigantes hoje sabemos fenômeno descrito wallas especificamente inglês passageiro apareceu reação disfunções características estágios iniciais democracia representativa questionamentos semelhantes continuam manifestar toda parte duas vertentes nitidamente diferen ciadas notou referente atitudes cidadão comum relação funcionamento instituições sobretudo legislativos partidos políticos outra propriamente filosófica refere ideologia liberal mundo modernoo azedume primeira vertente sido regularmente pesquisado entidades acadêmicas todo mundo difícil dizer existe consenso quanto causa formas características antídotos administrados eficácia duvidosa têm sido basicamente reformas institucionais concentrandose principalmente sistemas partidários eleitorais tudo faz crer cidadão comum quer ordem quer estado capaz mantêla deseja diluição destruição poder menos experiências anar quistas tresloucadas despreza “ política ” sentido comumente atribuído termo hesitaria acabar soubesse fazêlo valoriza finalidade última estado abomina meio atua sistema político raiz desse sentimento parece fator psicológico – desconforto cidadão comum diante certas exterioridades política cujas funções chega compreender bem luta políticos controle partidos chapas eleitorais labirinto táticas combate parlamentar retórica quase sempre entediante caráter vago francamente inexequível maioria promessas feitas durante campanhas outras segunda vertente nutrese ideias filosóficas estéticas abrangentes radicais formouse bojo grandes transformações lugar europa desde século xviii base materiais sociedade revolução industrial conflito class esfera estado direito transição absolutismo if ape go extinct so could entire forestsbonobos eat lot of fruit and fruit contains seed those seed travel through bonobo ’ s digestive system while bonobo itself travel around the forest few hour later the seed end up being deposited far from where the fruit were plucked and that is where the new tree come fromaccording to paper recently published if the bonobo disappeared the plant would also likely go extinct many tree and plant specie in congo rely almost exclusively on bonobo seed dispersalthe bonobo ha two major function here first of all many seed will not germinate well unless they have been “ handled ” by another specie stomach acid and intestinal process make the seed more able to absorb water and later sproutsecondly many seed will not succeed if they remain too close to their parental tree the seed that fell to the ground near their parent did not survive because they were choked off by the nearby plant the bonobo eat about 35 hour every day and travel mean of 12 kilometer from meal site before defecatingadaptado httpblogsscientificamericancomextinctioncountdownifapesgoextinctsocouldentireforestsqual explicação título

remember the good old day when you could have heatedyetenjoyable debate with your friend about thing that didn ’ t matter that much — time when you could be true fan of the manchester united soccer team when you didn ’ t come from the city of manchesterhow thing have changednow disagreement feel deadly serious like when your colleague pronounces that wearing face mask in public is threat to his liberty or when you see that one of your friend ha just tweeted that actually all life matter before you know it you ’ re feeling angry and forming harsh new judgment about your colleague and friend let ’ s take collective pause and breathe there are some way we can all try to have more civil disagreement in this febrile age of culture wars1 ‘ coupling ’ and ‘ decoupling ’ the first is to consider how inclined people are to ‘ couple ’ or ‘ decouple ’ topic involving wider political and social factor swedish data analyst john nerst ha used the term to describe the contrasting way in which people approach contentious issue those of u more inclined to ‘ couple ’ see them inextricably related to broader matrix of factor whereas those more predisposed to ‘ decouple ’ prefer to consider an issue in isolation to take crude example decoupler might consider in isolation the question of whether vaccine provides degree of immunity to virus coupler by contrast would immediately see the issue inextricably entangled in mesh of factor such pharmaceutical industry power and parental choice2 most of u are deeply committed to our belief especially concerning moral and social issue such that when we ’ re presented with fact that contradict our belief we often choose to dismiss those fact rather than update our beliefsa study at arizona state university u analysed more than 100000 comment on forum where user post their view on an issue and invite others to persuade them to change their mind the researcher found that regardless of the kind of topic people were more likely to change their mind when confronted with more evidence based argument “ our work may suggest that while attitude change is hardwon providing fact statistic and citation one ’ s argument can convince people to change their mind ” they concluded3 just be nicerfinally it ’ s easier said than done but let ’ s all try to be more respectful of and attentive to each other ’ s position we should this not just virtuous reason but because the more we create that kind of climate the more openminded and intellectually flexible we will all be inclined to be and then hopefully collectively we can start having more constructive disagreement — even in our present very difficult timeschristian jarrett wwwbbccom 14102020 adaptadopinterestcoma afirmação figura melhor dialoga conteúdo último parágrafo violência saúdemauro gomes aranha limajornal cremesp agosto 2016o aumento violência contra médicos enfermeiros finalmente passou encarado questão estado graças denúncias cremesp conselho regional medicina estado paulo corensp conselho regional enfermagem paulo secretaria segurança pública paulo sspsp mantém agora grupo trabalho debruça busca soluções problemaem recente reunião secretário adjunto sspsp sérgio sobrane comprometeuse tomar providências secretaria saúde sessp participou debate culminaram proposta cremesp coren protocolo orientar profissionais saúde lidar situações usuáriofamiliar mostre agressivo ameaçadorsimultaneamente sspsp preparará piloto intervenção baseado registros ameaças truculência capital bem sucedido multiplicado restante estadosão medidas oportunas levaremos frente contudo tal empenho bastante violência emerge raízes profundas governos negligenciam saúde cidadãos motivo rede pública padece graf problemas acesso continuidade atenção hospitais sucateados sob contingenciamento leitos serviços postos saúde estratégia saúde família equipes incompletas efetivação metas integrativas biopsicossociais brasileiro contribuinte assíduo pontual arca altas tributações mundo demandas saúde recebe caos indiferençaresignamse muitos todavia suportam indignidade sentemse humilhados reagem exaltamse eis chegamos extremo pesquisa encomen dada cremesp 2015 amostra 617 médicos 64 tomaram conhecimento vítimas violência ouvimos pacientes 41 entrevistados atribuíram razão agressões problemas demora serem atendidos estresse muitos pacientes poucos médicos consultas rápidas superficiaisser médico condição escolha escolhemos compreensão científica mecanismo humano revertida benefício sofre vocação chamado desafio apelo dor outrem exigirem fôlego sereni dade dedicação todos médicos pacientes situação cultivar cultura paz compromisso mútuo tarefas mínimasaos pacientes cabelhes cultivo percepção refletida meio precariedade posta governos cínicos estado médico apenas servidor visível detrás omiteaos médicos compreensão pacientes além enfermidades sofrem injustiças agravos sociaisa tolerância exatamente dom graça natural pendor esforço deliberado marco estrutural processo civilizadortarefas esforços compartilhados solução violência dentro nósin jornal cremesp órgão oficial conselho regionalde medicina estado paulo 339 agosto2016 remember the good old day when you could have heatedyetenjoyable debate with your friend about thing that didn ’ t matter that much — time when you could be true fan of the manchester united soccer team when you didn ’ t come from the city of manchesterhow thing have changednow disagreement feel deadly serious like when your colleague pronounces that wearing face mask in public is threat to his liberty or when you see that one of your friend ha just tweeted that actually all life matter before you know it you ’ re feeling angry and forming harsh new judgment about your colleague and friend let ’ s take collective pause and breathe there are some way we can all try to have more civil disagreement in this febrile age of culture wars1 ‘ coupling ’ and ‘ decoupling ’ the first is to consider how inclined people are to ‘ couple ’ or ‘ decouple ’ topic involving wider political and social factor swedish data analyst john nerst ha used the term to describe the contrasting way in which people approach contentious issue those of u more inclined to ‘ couple ’ see them inextricably related to broader matrix of factor whereas those more predisposed to ‘ decouple ’ prefer to consider an issue in isolation to take crude example decoupler might consider in isolation the question of whether vaccine provides degree of immunity to virus coupler by contrast would immediately see the issue inextricably entangled in mesh of factor such pharmaceutical industry power and parental choice2 most of u are deeply committed to our belief especially concerning moral and social issue such that when we ’ re presented with fact that contradict our belief we often choose to dismiss those fact rather than update our beliefsa study at arizona state university u analysed more than 100000 comment on forum where user post their view on an issue and invite others to persuade them to change their mind the researcher found that regardless of the kind of topic people were more likely to change their mind when confronted with more evidence based argument “ our work may suggest that while attitude change is hardwon providing fact statistic and citation one ’ s argument can convince people to change their mind ” they concluded3 just be nicerfinally it ’ s easier said than done but let ’ s all try to be more respectful of and attentive to each other ’ s position we should this not just virtuous reason but because the more we create that kind of climate the more openminded and intellectually flexible we will all be inclined to be and then hopefully collectively we can start having more constructive disagreement — even in our present very difficult timeschristian jarrett wwwbbccom 14102020 adaptadoin the fragment from the third paragraph “ when you see that one of your it ’ s perilous time to be statue not that it ha ever been particularly secure occupation exposed statue are to the element bird droppings and political windsjust ask queen victoria whose rounded frame perch atop hundred of plinth across the commonwealth with an air of solemn severe solidity but in 1963 in quebec member of separatist paramilitary group stuck dynamite under the dress of her local statue it exploded with force so great that her head wa found 100 yard awaytoday the head is on display in museumwith her body preserved in room some mile away the art historian vincent giguère said that “ the fact it ’ s damaged is what make it so important ” there ’ s another reason to conserve the beheaded victoria statue of woman standing alone and demanding attention in public space are extremely rareto be made statue woman had to be naked muse royalty or the mother of god or occasionally an icon of war justice or virtue boadicea in her chariot in london the statue of liberty in new yorkstill of 925 public statue in britain only 158 are woman standing on their own of those 110 are allegorical or mythical and 29 are of queen victoriajulia baird the new york time september 4 2017 adaptadoconforme texto grau importância atribuído estátua rainha vitória quebec reside fato escultura

antarctic ozone layer show sign of healingby tessa berenson tcberensonhttptimecom4391034antarcticozonelayerhealingjuly 1 2016a study published in the journal science found that the hole in the ozone layer is closing the researcher found that the average size of the ozone hole when measured each september ha shrunk by more than 17 million square mile since 2000the scientist credit the 1987 montreal protocol which cut the production of chemical that damage the ozone layer with facilitating the healing “ we can now be confident that the thing weve done have put the planet on path to heal ” susan solomon of the massachusetts institute of technology who led the team of scientist said in statementescolha alternativa cujo conteúdo encontra texto acima

leia texto responder questões 11 20can plant hearflora may be able to detect thesounds of flowing water or munching insectspseudoscientific claim that music help plant grow have been made decade despite evidence that is shaky at best yet new research suggests some flora may be capable of sensing sound such the gurgle of water through pipe or the buzzing of insectsin recent study monica gagliano an evolutionary biologist at the university of western australia and her colleague placed pea seedling in pot shaped like an upsidedown y one arm of each pot wa placed in either tray of water or coiled plastic tube through which water flowed the other arm had dry soil the root grew toward the arm of the pipe with the fluid regardless of whether it wa easily accessible or hidden inside the tubing “ they just knew the water wa there even if the only thing to detect wa the sound of it flowing inside the pipe ” gagliano say yet when the seedling were given choice between the water tube and some moistened soil their root favored the latter she hypothesizes that these plant use sound wave to detect water at distance but follow moisture gradient to home in on their target when it is closerthe research reported earlier this year in oecologia is not the first to suggest flora can detect and interpret sound 2014 study showed the rock cress arabidopsis can distinguish between caterpillar chewing sound and wind vibration – the plant produced more chemical toxin after “ hearing ” recording of feeding insect “ we tend to underestimate plant because their response are usually le visible to u but leaf turn out to be extremely sensitive vibration detector ” say lead study author heidi m appel an environmental scientist now at the university of toledomarta zaraska wwwscientificamericancom 17052017no terceiro parágrafo trecho “ we tend to underestimate plant ” indica tendência

israel travel guideisrael ha always been standout destination from the day of prophet to the modern day nomad this tiny slice of land on the eastern mediteranean ha long attracted visitor while some arrive in the ‘ holy land ’ on spiritual quest many others are on cultural tour beach holiday and ecotourism trip weeding through israel ’ s convoluted history is both exhilarating and exhausting there are crumbling temple ruined city abandoned fort and hundred of place associated with the bible and while sense of adventure is required most site are safe and easily accessible most of all israel is about it incredible diverse population jew come from all over the world to live here while about 20 of the population is muslim politics are hard to get away from in israel everyone ha an opinion on how to move the country forward – with ready ear you ’ re sure to hear opinion from every side of the political spectrumdisponível wwwworldtravelguidenet acesso 15 jun2012antes viajar turistas geralmente buscam informações sobre local onde pretendem ir trecho guia viagens israel

one of the thing ‘ that made an incredible impression on in the film wa frida ’ s comfort in and celebration of her own unique beauty she didn ’ t try to fit into conventional idea or image about womanhood or what make someone or something beautiful instead she fully inhabited her own unique gift not particularly caring what other people thought she wa magnetic and beautiful in her own right she painted year not to be commercial success or to be discovered but to express her own inner pain joy family love and culture she absolutely and resolutely wa who she wa the trueness of her own unique vision and her ability to stand firmly in her own truth wa what made her successful in the endhutzler ldisponivel wwwetbscreenwritingcomacesso 6 maio 2013a autora desse comentário sobre filme frida mostrase impressionada fato pintora

letter to the editor sugar fearmongering unhelpfulby the washington time tuesday june 25 2013in his recent piece “ is obesity disease ” web june 19 dr peter lind refers to highfructose corn syrup and other “ manufactured sugar ” “ poison ” that will “ guarantee storage of fat in the body ” current scientific research strongly indicates that obesity result from excessive calorie intake combined with sedentary lifestyle the fact is american are consuming more total calorie now than ever before according to the u department of agriculture our total percapita daily caloric intake increased by 22 percent from 2076 calorie per day in 1970 to 2534 calorie per day in 2010 — an additional 458 calorie only 34 of which come from increased added sugar intake vast majority of these calorie come from increased fat and flourcereals surprisingly the amount of caloric sweetener ie sugar highfructose corn syrup honey etc american consume ha actually decreased over the past decade we need to continue to study the obesity epidemic to see what more can be done but demonizing one specific ingredient accomplishes nothing and raise unnecessary fear that get in the way of real solution james m rippe shrewsbury massdisponível wwwwashingtontimescomacesso 29 jul 2013 adaptadoao abordar assunto “ obesidade ” seção jornal autor

revolución en la arquitectura chinalevantar rascacielos en 19 díasun rascacielos 57 pisos llama la atención en la china del siglo xxi salvo haya construido en 19 días claro y eso e precisamente lo ha conseguido broad sustainable building bsb una empresa dedicada la fabricación purificadores aire y equipos aire acondicionado grandes infraestructuras ahora ha empeñado en liderar una revolución con su propio modelo arquitectura modular prefabricada subraya su presidente zhang yue e una fórmula económica ecológica segura y limpia ese último término además lo utiliza tanto referirse al polvo produce en la construcción los gruesos sobres suelen circular debajo la mesa en adjudicaciones y permisos varios “ quiero nuestros edificios alumbren una nueva en la arquitectura y conviertan en símbolo la lucha contra la contaminación y el cambio climático e la mayor amenaza la enfrenta la humanidad ” sentencia “ e montar un lego apenas hay subcontratación lo cual ayuda mantener un costo bayo y un control calidad estricto y permite eliminar también la corrupción inherente al sector ” explica la vicepresidenta bsb y responsable del mercado internacional jiang yandisponível httptecnologiaelpaiscom acesso 23 jun 2015 adaptadono texto alguns benefícios utilizar estruturas prémoldadas construção alto edifícios expressos meio palavra limpia expressão indica além produzir menos resíduos uso desse tipo estrutura

leia texto responder questões 21 28your screen freeze there ’ s weird echo dozen head stare at you there are the work huddle the oneonone meeting and then once you ’ re done the day the hangout with friend and family since the covid19 pandemic hit we ’ re on video call more than ever before – and many are finding it exhaustingbeing on video call requires more focus than face toface chat say gianpetro petriglier who study sustainable development in the workplace video chat mean we need to work harder to process nonverbal cue like facial expression the tone and pitch of the voice and body language “ our mind are together when our body feel we ’ re not and that dissonance tire u out ” he sayssilence is another challenge he add “ silence creates natural rhythm in reallife conversation however when it happens in video call you become anxious about the technology ” one 2014 study by german academic showed that delay on phone or conferencing system shaped our view of people negatively even delay of 12 second made people perceive the responder le friendly or focusedour presentday circumstance – whether quarantine working from home or otherwise – are also feeding in aspect of our life that used to be separate – work school friend family – are all happening in the same space individual have multiple aspect – context dependent social role relationship activity and goal – and we find the variety healthy say petriglieri when these aspect are reduced we become more vulnerable to negative feelingsa lack of downtime after we ’ ve fulfilled some work or family commitment may be another factor in our tiredness while some of u may be putting higher expectation on ourselves due to worry over the economy or job loss “ there ’ s also that heightened sense of ‘ i need to be performing at my top level in situation ’ … some of u are kind of overperforming to secure our job ” lot of u are doing big group chat the first time whether it ’ s cooking and eating virtual dinner attending university catchup or holding birthday party friend if the call is meant to be fun why might it feel tiring part of it is whether you ’ re joining in because you want to or because you feel you ought to if you see it an obligation that mean more time that you ’ re ‘ on ’ opposed to getting breakexperts ’ suggestion zoom1 fatigue limiting video call to those that are necessary considering if video chat are really the most efficient option and maybe say petriglieri if you want to reach out go old school “ write letter to someone instead of meeting them on zoom tell them you really care about them ” manyu jiang disponível wwwbbccom 22abr2020 adaptado1 zoom video communication platform use in computer and smartphoneschoose the title which best summarizes the content of the article

associated with obesity by reducing it to 5 you would reduce the risk of all of those thing the challenge will be to get there ” the target of 5 of energy intake from free sugar amount to 25g woman five to six teaspoon and 35g seven to eight teaspoon men based on the average dietpublic health minister england jane ellison said “ we know eating too much sugar can have significant impact on health leia texto responder questões 28 30gm wheat morepestresistant than ordinary crop trial showsgm wheat designed to repel aphid is more effective at repelling the bug than standard variety major field trial ha revealedlan samplejune 25 2015a major field trial of gm wheat that is designed to repel aphid small insect ha found the crop is better protected against the pest than conventional wheat the result come from two year of trial that compared aphid attack on standard wheat plant with those suffered by gm version modified to release natural aphid repellentscientists created the gm wheat strain in the hope that it would deter aphid which devour the crop and can leave them with infection they modified the wheat to produce natural pheromone which aphid release when under attack from predator the “ aphid alarm ” make the bug flee to safety aphid are not the only organism that release the odour though more than 400 plant have evolved to secrete the same substance called ebeta farnesene or ebf including peppermint the chemical double up an attractant some insect that kill aphid such parasitic waspsprior to the field trial lab test at rothamsted found that the pheromone worked highlyeffective aphid repellent the work bolstered researcher ’ hope that the trial would demonstrate the crop ’ s resilience against aphid in the wild an aphidresistant wheat crop could have huge benefit farmer and the environment because the plant would langer need to be sprayed with insecticide “ the disappointing thing is that when we tested it in the field we didnt find any significant reduction in aphid settlement in the test plot ” said toby bruce who worked on the trial detail of the trial are published in the journal scientific reportswwwtheguardiancomadaptadoo trecho terceiro parágrafo “ an aphidresistant wheat crop could have huge benefit farmer and the environment because the plant would longer need to be sprayed with insecticide ”

leia texto responder questões 71 80the placebo effect amazing and realnovember 2 2015robert h shmerlingthe placebo effect is mysterious thing i ’ ve long been fascinated by the idea that something inert and harmless sugar pill could relieve person ’ s pain or hasten their recovery just by the expectation that it would study use placebo – an inactive treatment such sugar pill – in an attempt to understand the true impact of the active drug comparing what happens to group of patient taking the active drug with the result of those taking placebo can help researcher understand just how good the active drug isthe word “ placebo ” come from latin and mean “ i shall please ” and “ please ” it doe in study after study many patient who take placebo show improvement in their symptom or conditionthe placebo effect is realrecent research on the placebo effect only confirms how powerful it can be – and that the benefit of placebo treatment aren ’ t just “ all in your head ” measureable physiological change can be observed in those taking placebo similar to those observed among people taking effective medication in particular blood pressure heart rate and blood test result have been shown to improve among subset of research subject who responded to placeboof course not everyone ha therapeutic response to placebo if that were the case we wouldn ’ t need medication at all instead we could simply wield the power of suggestion understanding why certain people improve with placebo treatment and others not is the “ holy grail ” of placebo researchnocebo placebo ’ s evil twinthe power of suggestion is doubleedged sword if you expect treatment to help you it ’ s more likely to so and if you expect treatment will be harmful you are more likely to experience negative effect that phenomenon is called the “ nocebo effect ” from the latin “ i shall harm ” example if you tell person that headache is common side effect of particular medication that person is more likely to report headache even if they are actually taking placebo the power of expectation is formidable and probably play significant role in the benefit and the side effect of commonly prescribed medicationswwwhealthharvardedu adaptadoo trecho segundo parágrafo “ and ‘ please ’ it doe ” sentido equivalente português

texto 1call to halve target added sugarpeople need to more than halve their intake of added sugar to tackle the obesity crisis according to scientific advice the government in englanda report by the scientific advisory committee on nutrition sacn say sugar added to food or naturally present in fruit juice and honey should account 5 of energy intakemany fail to meet the old 10 target the sugar industry said “ demonizing one ingredient ” would not “ solve the obesity epidemic ” the body reviewed 600 scientific study on the evidence of carbohydrate – including sugar – on health to develop the new recommendation one 330ml can of soft drink would take typical adult up to the proposed 5 daily allowance without factoring in sugar from any other sourceprof ian macdonald chairman of the sacn working group on carbohydrate said “ the evidence that we have analyzed show quite clearly that high free sugar intake in adult is associated with increased energy intake and obesity there is also an association between sugarsweetened beverage and type2 diabetes in child there is clear demonstration that sugarsweetened beverage are associated with obesity by reducing it to 5 you would reduce the risk of all of those thing the challenge will be to get there ” the target of 5 of energy intake from free sugar amount to 25g woman five to six teaspoon and 35g seven to eight teaspoon men based on the average dietpublic health minister england jane ellison said “ we know eating too much sugar can have significant impact on health and this advice confirms that we want to help people make healthier choice and get the nation into healthy habit life this report will inform the important debate taking place about sugar ” wwwbbccom adaptadotexto 2eating more fruit and veggie won ’ t make you lose weightwe ’ re often told to eat more fruit and vegetable but the chance that you ’ ll lose weight just by eating more of these food are slim new research suggests increased fruit and vegetable intake is only effective weight loss if you make an effort to reduce your calorie intake overallin other word you need to exercise or consume fewer calorie to shed those poundsdon ’ t let that stop you from including more fruit and veggie in your diet though even if they don ’ t directly help you lose weight these food still provide number of health benefitshttpthechartblogscnncom adaptadode acordo texto 1 indústria açucareira

roman document discoveredwe often think that the best information from the roman world come from egypt where the dryness preserve papyrus however in britain the reverse condition occur at vindolanda – roman fort located two mile behind hadrian ’ s wall – the humidity preserved wooden writing tablet that were thrown into bonfire when the fort wa evacuated in ce 105 these wooden tablet were one of the most important discovery made in roman britain in the 20th century they were used not grand writing but memoranda and account so they provide the best insight into life in the roman army found anywhere in the world one of the tablet say octavius to candidus “ i need money i have bought 5000 bushel of grain and unless you send some money i shall lose my deposit and be embarrassed ” adaptado httpwwwarchaeologycoukspecialsthetimeline ofbritainvindolanda2htm acessado 28082016os documentos descobertos vindolanda

espontâneas “ homem cordial ” forma natural viva converteu fórmula além disso polidez algum modo organização defesa ante sociedade detémse parte exterior epidérmica indivíduo podendo servir necessário texto questões 19 21plants not only remember when you touch them but they can also make risky decision that are sophisticated those made by human all without brain or complex nervous systemsresearchers showed that when faced with the choice between pot containing constant level of nutrient or one with unpredictable level plant will pick the mystery pot when condition are sufficiently poorin set of experiment dr shemesh from telhai college in israel and alex kacelnik from oxford university grew pea plant and split their root between two pot both pot had the same amount of nutrient on average but in one the level were constant in the other they varied over time then the researcher switched the condition so that the average nutrient in both pot would be equally high or low and asked which pot would plant preferwhen nutrient level were low the plant laid more root in the unpredictable pot but when nutrient were abundant they chose the one that always had the same amountthe new york time june 30 2016 adaptadosegundo conclusões experimentos relatados texto plantas ervilha demonstraramferramenta imagem

recado dado stfeditorial folha spaulo 13 set 2016poucas vezes posse presidente supremo tribunal federal revestiu tanto simbolismo quanto cármen lúcia cuja chegada comando órgão cúpula judiciário consumou nesta segundafeira 12em cerimônia simple ministra quebrou protocolo início discurso vez cumprimentar primeiro presidente república michel temer pmdb cármen lúcia considerou maior autoridade presente “ excelência povo ” – saudou ante todos “ cidadão brasileiro ” partisse outrem gesto talvez pudesse considerado mero populismo vindo nova presidente stf guarda coerência outras iniciativas valor simbólico semelhante abrir mão carro oficial motorista dispensar festa própria possecomo pudesse dúvidas respeito disso cármen lúcia deixa clara intenção próximo biênio conduzir stf mesma austeridade pauta conduta pessoal “ privilégios incompatíveis república ” disse folha ano passadoé imaginar assim nova presidente fato reveja principais bandeiras agenda corporativista antecessor ricardo lewandowski indefensável aumento salarial ministros supremonão único contraste gestões esperase cármen lúcia moralize gastos diárias viagens oficiais stf amplie transparência previsibilidade decisões judiciário acima tudo resgate papel disciplinar conselho nacional justiça esvaziado sob batuta lewandowskidesfrutando sólida reputação meio jurídico ministra suscita altas expectativas ainda outro motivo relatou processo exdeputado federal natan donadon condenado desvio dinheiro público primeiro político ter prisão determinada stf desde promulgação constituição 1988daí ministro celso mello sentiu vontade ante discurso cármen lúcia proferir palavras duríssimas contra “ marginais república cuja atuação criminosa efeito deletério subverter dignidade função política própria atividade governamental ” plenário supremo diversos figurões política investigados processados crime contra patrimônio público apenas ouviam constrangidos recado gestão cármen lúcia possa ir além plano zombie neurosciencei don ’ t know if cockroach dream but i imagine if they jewel wasp feature prominently in their nightmare these small solitary tropical wasp are of little concern to u human after all they don ’ t manipulate our mind so that they can serve u up willing living meal to their newborn they to unsuspecting cockroach the story is simple if grotesque the female wasp control the mind of the cockroach she feed to her offspring taking away their sense of fear or will to escape their fate what turn once healthy cockroach into mindless zombie it ’ s venom not just any venom either specific venom that act like drug targeting the cockroach ’ s brainadaptado christie wilcox zombie neuroscience scientific american new york v 315 n 2 p 70–73 2016de acordo autor

texto questões 19 21plants not only remember when you touch them but they can also make risky decision that are sophisticated those made by human all without brain or complex nervous systemsresearchers showed that when faced with the choice between pot containing constant level of nutrient or one with unpredictable level plant will pick the mystery pot when condition are sufficiently poorin set of experiment dr shemesh from telhai college in israel and alex kacelnik from oxford university grew pea plant and split their root between two pot both pot had the same amount of nutrient on average but in one the level were constant in the other they varied over time then the researcher switched the condition so that the average nutrient in both pot would be equally high or low and asked which pot would plant preferwhen nutrient level were low the plant laid more root in the unpredictable pot but when nutrient were abundant they chose the one that always had the same amountthe new york time june 30 2016 adaptadode acordo experimentos relatados texto condições adversas plantas ervilha priorizaram crescimento raízes vasos apresentaram níveis nutrientes

leia texto responder questões 24 30prescriptions fighting epidemicsepidemics have plagued humanity since the dawn of settled life yet success in conquering them remains patchy expert predict that global one that could kill more than 300 million people would come round in the next 20 to 40 year what pathogen would cause it is anybody ’ s guess chance are that it will be virus that lurks in bird or mammal or one that that ha not yet hatched the scariest are both highly lethal and spread easily among human thankfully bug that excel at the first tend to be weak at the other but mutation – ordinary business germ – can change that in blink moreover when human get too close to beast either wild or packed in farm an animal disease can become human onea frontrunner global pandemic is the seasonal influenza virus which mutates so much that vaccine must be custommade every year the spanish flu pandemic of 1918 which killed 50 million to 100 million people wa potent version of the “ swine flu ” that emerged in 2009 the h5n1 “ avian flu ” strain deadly in 60 of case came about in the 1990s when virus that sickened bird made the jump to human ebola hiv and zika took similar routewwweconomistcom 08022018 adaptadode acordo segundo parágrafo

largest prime number discovered with more than 23m digitsknown simply m77232917 the figure is arrived at by calculating two to the power of 77232917 and subtracting one leaving gargantuan string of 23249425 digit the result is nearly one million digit longer than the previous record holder discovered in january 2016 the number belongs to rare group of socalled mersenne prime number named after the 17th century french monk marin mersenne like any prime number mersenne prime is divisible only by itself and one but is derived by multiplying two together over and over before taking away one the previous recordholding number wa the 49th mersenne prime ever found making the new one the 50thadaptado ian sample “ largest prime number discovered with more than 23m digit ” the guardian 04 012018considerando informações contidas excerto anterior números seguir primo mersenne

antibiotic resistance is possible because bacteria are able to exchange genetic material through process known bacterial conjugation in one experiment resistance to tetracycline commonly used antibiotic wa studied in escherichia coli by introducing tetracyclineresistant bacterium to tetracyclinesensitive strain the resistant bacterium ’ s genome contained protein called an “ efflux pump ” polypeptide that localizes to the cell membrane and expels certain small molecule from the cellusing fluorescent marking researcher observed the dna encoding one specific efflux pump in between resistant bacterium and sensitive bacterium with live cell microscopy they tracked the fluorescence to see how the dna migrated from one cell to another and how it wa incorporated and expressed in the recipient bacteriumfonte sophie nolivos outros science washington v 364 n 6442p 778782 maio2019com base texto conhecimentos assinale alternativa correta

nuclear fusion is reaction in which atomic nucleus merge to form the nucleus of new atom the mass of the new atom ’ s nucleus is lower than the sum of the merging nucleus ’ s mass difference that is released energy this is instance the reaction that occurs in the sun the energy released during fusion can be calculated by the equation δmc2 where δm is the difference between the initial and final mass in the reaction and c is the speed of light when calculating the aforementioned energy nucleus mass can be conveniently quantified using the atomic mass unit u which is roughly equivalent to 900 mev 1 u → 900 mev consider the hypothetical nuclear fusion reaction 222x 4y → 221z note that the mass of 222x 4y and 221z are 222 u 4 u and 221 u respectively the amount of energy released in this reaction is

atenção questões números 1 12 referemse texto segueum filme nacional 2003 − narradores javé eliane caffé − mostra vilarejo fictício amea çado inundado grande represa pobres esquecidos todos habitantes sabem defender voz parece en contrar solução javé precisa reconhecida co mo “ patri mônio ” poi assim tornaria ci dade submersa duas dimensões dessa fala re cem assinaladas “ patri mônio ” aparece recurso reivindicação palavra enun cia naquela específica cena evidencia quanto deixou termo técnico especiali zado vinculado saber política formal pa ra tornar lugarcomum táfora poderosa submersão equivale esque cimento reconhecimento reivin dicação posse patrimônio demanda visibilidade desprovidos recursos materiais pudessem considerados valor histórico narradores javé podem recordar reinventar histórias mito fundação patrimônio hoje chamamos imaterial intangívelo termo “ patrimônio ” latim pater pai tor nouse corriqueiro adjetivação espraiou patrimônio pode histórico ambiental arqueo lógico artístico material imaterial etc qualifica ções comumente subsumidas sob guardachuva “ cultural ” remissão pai patriarca conduz legado herança − acaso termo inglês exatamente heritageno filme citado bastava reconhecer algo importante preciso escrever anotar identificar – passar adiante conjunto práticas pode transmutar relatos estórias passadas conversas informais costume “ patrimônio ” − cidade grupo região nação patrimônio representação coletiva outra qualquer sim prática constituída processo atribuição valor deve reconhecido grupo disposto conserválo outras palavras patrimônio histórico remete políticas públicas ações têm lugar esfera públicaos grupos sociais atribuem valores distintos ben materiais memórias marcas territoriais nomeiam − desse modo distinguem classificam − ambiente rodeia destacam passagens história comum passado coletivo elegem paisagens fala mo patrimônio histórico cultural etc disso trata conjunto ben materiais ima teriais fruto decisão partiu identificação algo merecia destacado retirado certo fluxo corriqueiro coisas rotina cotidiana bem tido especial bem chamase bem patrimonialo termo hoje lugarcomum duplo sentido corriqueiro parece discurso todos pode lugar compartilhado ponto encontro saberes disciplinas políticas contudo diante fenômeno universal tampouco permanente frança preocupações patrimônio usar termo então utilizado monumentos início após revolução francesa inglaterra meio revolução industrial vitorianos denunciavam civilização moderna percebida raízes voltavam passado préindustrial localizado arquitetura brasil descoberta patrimônio iminência perdido vinculou revolução qualquer tipo debate início nada revolucionária primeira república 18891930 cidades passavam reformas urbana pautadas “ bota abaixo ” − ocorreu rio janeiro recife começo século xx − consolidouse estado novoadaptado rubino silvana patrimônio história memória reivindicação recurso in agenda bra sileira temas sociedade mudança orgs andré botelho lilia moritz schwarcz paulo companhia letras 2011 p 392 393considerado contexto segmento corretamente traduzido

questões números 01 05 tomam base passagem romance autran dourado 1926 2012a gente honório cotaquando coronel joão capistrano honório cota mandou erguer sobrado pouco trinta ano homem sério velho reservado cumpridor cuidava trajes aparência medida jaquetão casimira inglesa colete linho atravessado grossa corrente ouro relógio calça todos cidade — brim certas ocasiões batizado morte casamento — então parelho igual sempre bem passada vinco perfeito dava gosto vero passo vagaroso pressa — mundo podium esperar peito magro estufado gestos lentos voz pausada grave descia rua igreja cumprimentando cerimoniosamente nobremente passavam chegavam janela muitas vezes vêlo passardesde longe gente adivinhava vindo alto magro descarnado ave pernalta grande porte sendo assim tão descomunal podium desajeitado dava sempre impressão grande ponderada figura jogava pernas lados trazia abertas esticavaas feito medisse passos quebrando joelhos retoquando montado indo fazenda pedra menina cavalo branco ajaezado couro trabalhado prata aí então sim grande imponente figura enchia vista parecia daqueles cavaleiros antigos fugidos amadis gaula palmeirim iam guerra armados cavaleirosópera mortos 1970em conjunto descrição coronel sugere figura

questões números 06 10 focalizam passagem artigo cláudia vassalloaliadas concorrentesalguns números estados unidos 60 formados universidades mulheres metade europeias mercado trabalho passou universidades japão mulheres têm níveis semelhantes educação deixam mercado assim casam têm filhos tradição joga contra economia governo credita parte estagnação últimos ano ausência participação feminina mercado trabalho brasileiras avançam rápido educação atualmente 12 mulheres têm diploma universitário — ante 10 homens metade garotas 15 entrevistadas pesquisa ocde1 disse pretender fazer carreira engenharia ciências — áreas especialmente promissorasagora condição minoria vai caindo terra padrões comportamento começam mudar cada vez menos mulheres dispostas abdicar natureza nome carreira trata mudar essência trabalho obrigações homens mulheres têm encarar trata trabalhar menos ter menos ambição questão forma provável legisladores empresas flexíveis abrigar mulheres talento desistiram papel mãe porque fato grande única questão gênero importamais fortalecidas preparadas mulheres lugar sol empresas jeito desistirão porque capazes ganhar dinheiro outra forma 83 milhões empresas lideradas mulheres estados unidos — tipo empreendedorismo cresce país acordo estudo ey2 brasil 104 milhões empreendedoras maior índice 20 maiores economias número crescente migrado grandes empresas próprio negócio fatos mostram empresas todo mundo cedo tarde decidir querem ter metade população aliada concorrenteexame outubro 20131 ocde organização cooperação desenvol vi mento econômico2 ey organização global objetivo auxiliar clientes fortalecerem negócios redor mundoindique acepção palavra “ estagnação ” melhor enquadra contexto primeiro parágrafo

responder questões números 11 15 leia poema catulo paixão cearense 18631946o azulão ticoticosdo começo fim diaum belo azulão cantavae pomar atento ouviao trilos harmoniacada vez enfloravase ticotico outras avesvaiavam cançãomais doce ainda ouviaa flauta desse azulãoum papagaio surpresode ver grande desprezodo azulão desprezavaum dia cantavae bando ticoticosnuma algazarra vaiavalhe perguntou “ azulãoolha dizeme razãopor estás cantandoe recebes vaiadesses garotos joviaistu continuas gorgeandoe cada vez canta ” numas volatas sonoraso azulão respondeu “ caro amigo prezo muitoesta garganta sublimee voz maravilhosaeste dom deus deuquando pouco descantavapensando ouvidonestes matos ninguémum sabiá escutavanum capoeirão escondidogritou lá — colegabravos bravo bempergunto agora vocêquem dia aplaudidopelo príncipe cantosde celestes harmoniasirmão gonçalves dia cantores ricos— caso pode fazerdas vaias ticoticos ” nota editor simbolicamente rui barbosa representado neste sabiá poi “ águia haia ” maiores admiradores catulo prefaciador livro poemas braviospoemas escolhidos sdse verso 32 33 palavras “ sabiá ” “ capoeirão ” pronunciadas “ sabiá ” “ capoeirão ” tai verso quebrariam padrão ritmo demais poi passariam

atenção responder questões números 76 78 considere texto abaixoenvironmental factor influencing the risk of autismpadideh karimi elahe kamali seyyed mohammad mousavi and mojgan karahmadi autism described by asperger in 1938 and kanner in 1943 is severe neurodevelopmental disorder and belongs to autism spectrum disorder asds including autism asperger syndrome rett syndrome unidentified pervasive developmental disorder and childhood disintegrative disorder cdd autism is four to five time more common among boy than girl the most prominent clinical and phenotypic feature of autism are extensive disability in social and behavioral communication language impairment or inability to speak and strong tendency toward stereotyped and repetitive pattern of behavior regarding statistical report the prevalence of autism had increased from 45 case per 10000 child in 1980s to 30–60 case in 1990s and through an astonishing increase there are about 80 per 1000 child aged 8 year in 2004 and 90 per 1000 in 2006 or 1 in every 110 child aged 8 year in 2006 in 2012 combined asd prevalence of 113 per 1000 child aged 8 year or 1 in 88 child wa published by the autism and developmental disability monitoring network with regard to it progressive increase over the last two decade and lack of effective treatment and moreover the difficulty imposed on the society and family of autistic child importance of investigation on cause of this disease and an effort to prevent it become clear study of identical twin and lack of complete concordance among them and excessive genetic study with conclusive result unveil the importance of environmental risk factor and their role in the etiology of autism hence the interaction between susceptible gene and environmental factor have been proposed the major mechanism of autism etiology none of the environmental factor however is sufficient to yield autism but rather collection of them can be involved in it incidence these can be divided into prenatal natal and postnatal risk factor advanced parental age particularly paternal age ha been identified one of the most important prenatal risk factor of autism in many study maternal and paternal age older than or equal to 34 year ha been found associated with increased risk of autism in their offspring however in other study the relationship between child autism and the age of both parent or even the age of one parent is rejected intriguingly the relationship between increased risk of autism and elevated paternal age ha been approved in most study particularly study wa conducted among iranian people in 2010 to explore the presence or absence of association between parental age and risk of autism based on this study autism risk increase by 29 every 10year elevation in father ’ age in other word father aged between 34 and 39 had nearly twofold greater risk and those who are older than 40 have more than twofold 258 greater risk to have an affected child in comparison to one aged 2529 year old in other study in japan and china similar relationship were explored between paternal age and increased risk of autism lack of any correlation between maternal age and susceptibility of autism in these three mentioned study ha critical importance study involving maternal age have shown that being small gestational age can increase the risk of autism due to lack of physical maturity inability and poor maternal care mother who are younger than 20 may be exposed to intrauterine growth retardation of fetus and preterm birth which are both associated with increased risk of autismadapted from journal of research in medical science 2017 2227segundo informações texto
