responda questões 55 63 acordo texto abaixothe drug don ’ t work what happens after antibioticsantibiotic resistance is growing so fast that routine surgery could soon become impossible but scientist are fighting back in the battle against infection ‘ you essentially trick the bacteria ’ kim lewis one of two researcherswho discovered teixobactin photograph adam glanzman1 the first antibiotic that didn ’ t work debbi forsythe wa trimethoprim in march 2016 forsythe genial primary care counsellor from morpeth northumberland contracted urinary tract infection utis are common more than 150 million people worldwide contract one every year so when forsythe saw her gp they prescribed the usual treatment threeday course of antibiotic when few week later she fainted and started passing blood she saw her gp again who again prescribed trimethoprim2 three day after that forsythe ’ s husband pete came home to find his wife lying on the sofa shaking unable to call help he rushed her to aampe she wa put on second antibiotic gentamicin and treated sepsis complication of the infection that can be fatal if not treated quickly the gentamicin didn ’ t work either doctor sent forsythe ’ s blood testing but such test can take day bacteria must be grown in culture then tested against multiple antibiotic to find suitable treatment five day after she wa admitted to hospital forsythe wa diagnosed with an infection of multidrug resistant coli and given ertapenem one of the socalled “ last resort ” antibiotics3 it worked but damage from forsythe ’ s episode ha lingered and she life in constant fear of an infection reoccurring six month after her collapse she developed another uti resulting again in hospital stay “ i ’ ve had to accept that i will longer get back to where i wa ” infection she say “ my daughter and son said they felt like they lost their mum because i wasn ’ t who i used to be ” but forsythe wa fortunate sepsis currently kill more people in the uk than lung cancer and the number is growing more of u develop infection immune to antibiotics4 antimicrobial resistance amr – the process of bacteria and yeast and virus evolving defense mechanism against the drug we use to treat them – is progressing so quickly that the un ha called it “ global health emergency ” at least 2 million american contract drugresistant every year socalled “ superbug ” spread rapidly in part because some bacteria are able to borrow resistance gene from neighbouring specie via process called horizontal gene transfer in 2013 researcher in china discovered coli containing mcr1 gene resistant to colistin lastline antibiotic that until recently wa considered too toxic human use colistinresistant infection have now been detected in at least 30 countries5 “ in india and pakistan bangladesh china and country in south america the resistance problem is already endemic ” say colin garner ceo of antibiotic research uk in may 2016 the uk government ’ s review on antimicrobial resistance forecast that by 2050 antibioticresistant infection could kill 10 million people per year – more than all cancer combined6 “ we have good chance of getting to point where lot of people there are effective antibiotic ” daniel berman leader of the global health team at nesta told the threat is difficult to imagine world without antibiotic mean returning to time without organ transplant without hip replacement without many nowroutine surgery it would mean million more woman dying in childbirth make many cancer treatment including chemotherapy impossible and make even the smallest wound potentially lifethreatening berman told “ those of u who are following this closely are actually quite scared ” 7 bacteria are everywhere in our body in the air in the soil coating every surface in their sextillion many bacteria produce antibiotic compound – exactly how many we don ’ t know – probably weapon in microscopic battle resource between different strain of bacteria that ha been going on billion of year because bacteria reproduce so quickly they are able to evolve with astonishing speed introduce bacteria to sufficiently weak concentration of an antibiotic and resistance can emerge within day penicillin resistance wa first documented in 1940 year before it first use in human common misconception is that people can become antibioticresistant they don ’ t – the bacteria dooliver franklinwallissun 24 mar 2019in httpswwwtheguardiancomglobal2019mar24thedrugsdontworkwhathappensafterantibioticsde acordo terceiro parágrafo

leia texto responder questões 11 15it ’ s probable you ’ ve already replied to couple of email today sent some chat message and maybe performed quick internet search the day wear on you will doubtless spend even more time browsing online uploading image playing music and streaming videoeach of these activity you perform online come with small cost — few gram of carbon dioxide are emitted due to the energy needed to run your device and power the wireless network you access le obvious but perhaps even more energy intensive are the data centre and vast server needed to support the internet and store the content we access over italthough the energy needed single internet search or email is small approximately 41 billion people or 536 of the global population now use the internet those scrap of energy and the associated greenhouse gas emitted with each online activity can add upif we were to rather crudely divide the 17 billion tonne of greenhouse gas emission estimated to be produced in the manufacture and running of digital technology between all internet user around the world it mean each of u is responsible 400 g of carbon dioxide yearbut thing are not that simple — this figure can vary depending where in the world you are internet user in some part of the globe will have disproportionately large footprint one study estimated that 10 year ago the average australian internet user wa responsible the equivalent of 81 kg of carbon dioxide being emitted into the atmosphere improvement in energy efficiency economy of scale and use of renewable energy will doubtless have reduced this but it is clear that people in developed nation still account the majority of the internet ’ s carbon footprintsarah griffith wwwbbccom 05032020 adaptadothe excerpt from the first paragraph “ the day wear on ” ha the same meaning

the 900bn questionwhat is the belt and road initiativeby tom phillipshttpswwwtheguardiancom acessado 25102017it ’ s confusing title but it could turn out to be the largest ever infrastructure project with close to trillion dollar being invested across the globein concrete term the belt and road initiative is an immensely ambitious development campaign through which china want to boost trade and stimulate economic growth across asia and beyond it hope to so by building massive amount of infrastructure connecting it to country around the globe by some estimate china plan to pump 150bn into such project each year in report released at the start of this year rating agency fitch said an extraordinary 900bn in project were planned or underwaythe belt and road initiative ha two main prong one is called the ‘ silk road economic belt ’ the belt and the other the ‘ 21st century maritime silk road ’ the road bewilderingly the ‘ road ’ is not actually road but rather sea route linking china ’ s southern coast to east africa and the mediterranean the ‘ belt ’ is series of overland corridor connecting china with europe via central asia and the middle easta iniciativa belt and road

formato globalfolha spaulo 08 out 2017fernando donascifolhapressvista aérea centro pauloeles convictos terra plana gravidade existe curso complô cientistas agências governamentais convencer contrário constitui tribos exóticas passaram existir ganharam visibilidade internetno caso tela movimentos terraplanistas modernos existem menos desde ano 50 têm raízes fundamentalismo bíblico parecem viver porém surto inflacionário proliferação site pretendem provar cientificamente certosde tão absurda facilmente desmontável tese mereceria comentário tipo coletividade virtual sintoma fenômeno geral envolve relacionamento grupos mundo digitalpelo lado positivo ninguém condenado solidão conectar 3 bilhões pessoas torno qualquer tema internet torna quase impossível heterodoxo pensantes encontre alguém defenda ideias tão excêntricas quanto suasisso aplica inclinações políticas gostos artísticos preferências sexuais tratase alternativa formidável vê incompreendido rejeitado familiares vizinhoshá contudo faceta menos brilhante nessa tendência devido efeitos psicológicos frequentes interações indivíduos pensam forma semelhante isolam demais incomum tai comunidades tornem cada vez radicais descoladas realidadesob aspecto exemplo terraplanistas afigura quase benigno ideias têm reduzido impacto prático baixíssima chance viralizaçãomuito perigosas te defendidas militantes antivacinação facções terroristas estado islâmico valem rede mundial computadores difundir mensagem conquistar orientar adeptos aqui toda sociedade corre riscotambém nesse caldo cultura brotam famigeradas “ fake news ” notícias falsas criadas máfé propagadas meio balbúrdia informativaboatos te estapafúrdias teorias conspiratórias ideologias tóxicas claro sempre circularam mundo agora encontraram veículo ideal difusão terraplanista todo modo preço razoável pagar expansão possibilidades expressarmos amarrasdisponível httpswww1folhauolcombropiniao2017101925264formatoglobalshtml acesso 08 out 2017o uso elementos conexão ideias segundo sexto parágrafos – “ porém ” “ contudo ” – estabelecem respectivamente relação sentido

kiss or kill what robot can humanitya human kiss can bem delivered longdistance by humanoid gobetween if it doesn ’ t decide to blow you to piece first those are just some of the innovation in robotics showcased at festival in sheffield this weeknicola davisthe observer sunday 14 september 2014in httpwwwtheguardiancomtechnology2014sep14robotssheffield newageofroboticsgunikeywordnewsgrid20 main220 discover 20pickable 20with20editable20override pickable20with20 editable20overrideposition1anchor20image1 – from techno – sheepdog to android bedfellow the promise of robotics and the lure of artificial intelligence appears to know bound but will we ever be able to have proper natter with robot and just what will they look like now is your chance to find out2 – expert will be sharing the latest news in series of talk and demo under the banner of the new age of robotics part of sheffield ’ s wideranging festival of the mind which start on 18 september3 – “ science fiction robot are very different from real robot and we want to show people what technology are available now what might be round the corner and discus the societal issue around those ” say tony prescott director of the sheffield centre robotics and professor of cognitive neuroscience4 – collaboration between sheffield university and the city the festival will delve into the pro and con of emerging technology among the talk professor adrian cheok from city university london will share romantic vision of the future in his adultsonly “ x lecture ” explaining how “ digital intimacy ” could let u share physical sensation from hug to smell his team ha developed the “ kissenger ” method transmitting longdistance smooch using pair of device that capture and replicate lip movement5 – more cautious about embracing technofuture noel sharkey professor of artificial intelligence and robotics at sheffield university and cofounder of the international committee robot arm control will explore the potential danger of robowarfare “ robot weapon pose new and terrifying threat to humanity ” he say “ they will select their own target and attack them without human involvement ” 6 – more likely to amuse than unnerve however are two robot on show part of the festival ’ s interactive exhibition able to display range of emotion the state ofthe art humanoid zeno is keen to challenge visitor to game of simon say while paro roboseal developed in japan showcase one of the burgeoning application robot in health and social care prescott explains “ in our research we are looking at how useful this is – how effective it might be – in actually calming down people with alzheimer ’ s which is one of the application and we ’ re looking at how people with different personality might respond to those kind of robot ” 7 – there little doubt that technology develops so too will the ethical and social dilemma but while some view future “ singularity ” – the point where artificial intelligence exceeds our own – spelling the end of mankind prescott ha more sanguine outlook “ i think our job technologist is to think about those future and to see what we can start to now to ensure that we end up with the more optimistic scenario being realized and avoiding the dangerous ones8 – “ this festival of the mind is one small part of that – engaging with people about thing they are worried about and then in our research programme making sure that we anticipate those thing ” parágrafo 5 professor noel sharkey falará sobre

soberania indivíduohélio schwartsmanfolha spaulo 24102015são paulo – alguns leitores ficaram pouco bravo comigo porque afirmei coluna ontem legislação sobre costume estado moderno deve sempre seguir inspiração liberal conservadora diferentemente sugeriram certos missivistas escrevi porque preferências pessoais coincidem ideias dita progressistas porque existe diferença qualitativa papel duas visões mundo reservam leina visão conservadora legítimo estado opere ativamente promover coesão social force indivíduo conformarse “ statu quo ” dá dizer funcione pese certo autoritarismo intrínseco sociedades colocam interesses coletivos acima individuais tendem apresentar menores índices violência interpessoal menos desigualdade costumam menos inventivas outro problemajá liberais ênfase recai sobre liberdade individual bem espírito john stuart mill atitudes comportamentos exóticos pareçam podem legitimamente proibidos limitados resultarem dano objetivo demonstrável terceiros caso contrário “ sobre si corpo mente indivíduo soberano ” implicação óbvia dessa diferença enquanto perspectiva liberal permite cada grupo viva segundo próprias convicções ainda escala menor todo concepção conservadora exige franjas minoritárias renunciem valores trocando miúdos existem vários projetos lei proibir limitar aborto casamento gay nenhum intuito tornálos obrigatórios época consensos sociais podem mudar rapidamente conservadores deveriam principais interessados legislação bem liberalno primeiro parágrafo texto hélio schwartsman duas visões mundo quais autor refere

the following text refers to question 12 to 14the rolling stone impose high ticket price u tour “ is that lot ” say mick jaggerby jerry hopkins november 15 1969mick jagger performing on stage circa 1969los angeles—the rolling stone have returned to the united state their first tour in more than three yearsit begin with two evening show at the forum in los angeles november 8th with ticket priced from 550 to 850 this compare to 750 top price blind faith concert in the same arena 650 top the door and in both those concert ticket started at 350 in arranging this show previouslyset hockey game between the los angeles king and the new york ranger wa rescheduled – at the request of the man who owns both the forum and the kingsacts appearing at the concert here will include terry reid who will appear on all the date and the ike and tina turner revue negotiation were continuing to have ike and tina b b king and chuck berry join the stone in several other citiespromoters of the la concert said the gross the evening would exceed 275000 if the stone filled the 18000 seat in the forum both show similar gross on per show basis were expected throughout the tour with the stone getting guarantee of 25000 concert and up against take home percentage running close to 60000although figure such these are not unusual tour by group of this magnitude they did bring strong criticism from among others ralph gleason in the san francisco chronicle “ can the rolling stone actually need all that money ” gleason asked “ if they really dig the black musician much every note they play and every syllable they utter indicates is it possible to take out show with say ike and tina and some of the older men like howlin ’ wolf and let them share in the loot how much can the stone take back to merrie england after tax anyway how much must the british manager and the american manager and the agency rake off the top ” “ paying five six and seven dollar stone concert at the oakland coliseum say an hour of the stone seen quarter of mile away because the artist demand such outrageous fee that they can only be obtained under these circumstance say very bad thing to about the artist ’ attitude towards the public it say they despise their own audience ” when mick jagger wa confronted by this criticism at press conference at the beverly wilshire hotel he left the door slightly open to giving free concert sometime during the 13city 18concert tour but his tone didn ’ t seem too promising “ there ha been talk of that ” he said “ i should think toward the end we ’ ll have to see how thing go i don ’ t want to plan that right now ‘ cause we ’ re gon be here some while we ’ ve got time all that i don ’ t want to say that ’ s what we want to or not i ’ m leaving it rather blurry i ’ m not committing myself ” and about the ticket cost he strongly indicated that if some people thought price were high they might have been lot worse “ we were offered lot of money to some very good date – money in front in europe before we left really lot of bread we didn ’ t accept because we thought they ’ d be too expensive on the basis of the money we ’ d get we didn ’ t say that unless we walk out of america with x dollar we ain ’ t gon come we ’ re really not into that sort of economic scene either you ’ re gon sing and all that crap or you ’ re gon be an economist i really don ’ t know whether this is more expensive than recent tour by local band i don ’ t know how much people can afford i ’ ve idea is that lot you ’ ll have to tell ” wwwrollingstonecomaccording to the text the rolling stone

to the united state their first tour in more than three year it begin with two evening show at the forum in los angeles november 8th with ticket priced from 550 to 850 this compare to 750 top price blind faith concert in the same arena 650 top the door and in both those concert ticket started at 350 in arranging this show previouslyset hockey game between the los angeles king and the new york ranger wa rescheduled – at the request of the man who owns both the forum and the kingsacts appearing at the concert here will include terry reid who will appear on all the date and the ike and tina turner revue negotiation were continuing to have ike and tina b b king and chuck berry join the stone in several other citiespromoters of the la concert said the gross the evening would exceed 275000 if the stone filled the 18000 seat in the forum both show similar gross on per show basis were expected throughout the tour with the stone getting guarantee of 25000 concert and up against take home percentage running close to 60000although figure such these are not unusual tour by group of this magnitude they did bring strong criticism from among others ralph gleason in the san francisco chronicle “ can the rolling stone actually need all that money ” gleason asked “ if they really dig the black musician much every note they play and every syllable they utter indicates is it possible to take out show with say ike and tina and some of the older men like howlin ’ wolf and let them share in the loot how much can the stone take back to merrie england after tax anyway how much must the british manager and the american manager and the agency rake off the top ” “ paying five six and seven dollar stone concert at the oakland coliseum say an hour of the stone seen quarter of mile away because the artist demand such outrageous fee that they can only be obtained under these circumstance say very bad thing to about the artist ’ attitude towards the public it say they despise their own audience ” when mick jagger wa confronted by this criticism at press conference at the beverly wilshire hotel he left the door slightly open to giving free concert sometime during the 13city 18concert tour but his tone didn ’ t seem too promising “ there ha been talk of that ” he said “ i should think toward the end we ’ ll have to see how thing go i don ’ t want to plan that right now ‘ cause we ’ re gon be here some while we ’ ve got time all that i don ’ t want to say that ’ s what we want to or not i ’ m leaving it rather blurry i ’ m not committing myself ” and about the ticket cost he strongly indicated that if some people thought price were high they might have been lot worse “ we were offered lot of money to some very good date – money in front in europe before we left really lot of bread we didn ’ t accept because we thought they ’ d be too expensive on the basis of the money we ’ d get we didn ’ t say that unless we walk out of america with x dollar we ain ’ t gon come we ’ re really not into that sort of economic scene either you ’ re gon sing and all that crap or you ’ re gon be an economist i really don ’ t know whether this is more expensive than recent tour by local band i don ’ t know how much people can afford i ’ ve idea is that lot you ’ ll have to tell ” wwwrollingstonecomthe question that the promoter were asked and whose answer can be found in the phrase from 550 to 850 wa probably

female prisoner post sexy picture of themselves on social networkestelita ha carazzaifrom curitibaat least two detainee have taken picture and published them on social networking site from inside guarapuava public jail in the state of paranáthe picture taken on phone were found by prison guard and posted online last aprilthe 30 yearold detainee are in jail after being accused of drug trafficking both are serving provisional sentence and are yet to be convictedone ha been in jail since april and the other yeardetainees are not granted possession of cell phone and due to this breach they were awarded disciplinary sanction and have since been prevented from receiving visit or food sent by family member 30 daysadditionally this occurrence may prevent them from shortening their sentence if they are eventually convictedthey appear posing in underwear on concrete bed in the female dormitory which is decorated with animal printafter the prison guard discovered the image they inspected the room the two woman shared and found the cell phone used to take the picture “ this unfortunately happens detainee can hide thing very well ” the prison chief altemir nascimento saidaccording to nascimento 40 cell phone have been seized so far this year in the prison which also house mencell phone throwingthe location of the prison in downtown guarapuava make matter worseaccording to the prison chief during sunbathing pedestrian toss cell phone over the wall “ cell phone and drug are thrown over the wall this happens regularlyon every sunny day two or three item are thrown ” nascimento saidat the beginning of the year in order to bring the “ delivery ” to halt the prison chief decided to install protective net over the patio since then 77 cell phone have been caught on the nethttpwww1folhauolcombrinternacionaldetainees

genetically modified foodsgenetically modified gm food are food derived from organism whose genetic material dna ha been modified in way that doe not occur naturally eg through the introduction of gene from different organism currently available gm food stem mostly from plant but in the future food derived from gm microorganism or gm animal are likely to be introduced on the market most existing genetically modified crop have been developed to improve yield through the introduction of resistance to plant disease or of increased tolerance of herbicidesin the future genetic modification could be aimed at altering the nutrient content of food reducing it allergenic potential or improving the efficiency of food production system all gm food should be assessed before being allowed on the market faowho codex guideline exist risk analysis of gm foodwwwwhointaccording to the text genetically modified food

leia texto responder questões 28 30gm wheat morepestresistant than ordinary crop trial showsgm wheat designed to repel aphid is more effective at repelling the bug than standard variety major field trial ha revealedlan samplejune 25 2015a major field trial of gm wheat that is designed to repel aphid small insect ha found the crop is better protected against the pest than conventional wheat the result come from two year of trial that compared aphid attack on standard wheat plant with those suffered by gm version modified to release natural aphid repellentscientists created the gm wheat strain in the hope that it would deter aphid which devour the crop and can leave them with infection they modified the wheat to produce natural pheromone which aphid release when under attack from predator the “ aphid alarm ” make the bug flee to safety aphid are not the only organism that release the odour though more than 400 plant have evolved to secrete the same substance called ebeta farnesene or ebf including peppermint the chemical double up an attractant some insect that kill aphid such parasitic waspsprior to the field trial lab test at rothamsted found that the pheromone worked highlyeffective aphid repellent the work bolstered researcher ’ hope that the trial would demonstrate the crop ’ s resilience against aphid in the wild an aphidresistant wheat crop could have huge benefit farmer and the environment because the plant would langer need to be sprayed with insecticide “ the disappointing thing is that when we tested it in the field we didnt find any significant reduction in aphid settlement in the test plot ” said toby bruce who worked on the trial detail of the trial are published in the journal scientific reportswwwtheguardiancomadaptadoo objetivo experimento trigo geneticamente modificado

new york todaygoodbye subway seatsby jonathan wolfe oct 5 2017httpswwwnytimescom acessado 10102017 adaptadothe new seatless area on redesignede train car credit metropolitan transit authoritygood morning on this warming thursdaysubway rider have you noticed anything missing from your commute like maybe seat on tuesday the metropolitan transportation authority rolled out redesigned subway car on the line with some of the seat removedthe agency hope that up to 10 more people will be able to squeeze into each new car — meaning 80 to 100 extra commuter per train — to help reduce overcrowding in all 100 car will lose their seat in the pilot program the l train and thestreet shuttle are next in line the redesign according to the authorityyesterday we waited at the 34th street station few train to pas before one of the refurbished model with it navy blue wrapping pulled into the stationwith the seat removed at the front and back of the car it felt roomy even dare we say luxurious — though that likely won ’ t be the case during rush hour people were enthusiastic about the interior calling them “ bright ” “ cheerful ” even “ beautiful ” the deleted seat review were mixedé correto afirmar texto indica

leaning on the top of two seat woman lay across an entire row with her foot up this guy stood up the whole 6 hour so his wife could sleep now that is love she claimed in the caption3 – while some commenters expressed disbelief that cabin crew had allowed the man to stand six hour others said they thought the wife wa wrong to expect or allow him to so4 – thats not love thats selfishness on the woman part one commenter said cant she just place her head on his shoulder and sleep love doesnt work like that5 – unless shes sick and this is the only rest position in the circumstance that will make her stay alive if not it doe not make sense said another6 – if that is love then i rather be lonely said third7 – another said i wont judge their marriage my hub is the kind of man who would this but i am not the kind of wife to ask this of him8 – it not the first time plane etiquette sparked debate online9 – in march u man 220 compensation demand from an obese passenger taking up part of his seat proved controversial reddit user big bawluh had been booked on fivehour flight which he said he endured uncomfortably pressed up against to be compensated10 – the problem here wa that this large dude stuck you with being uncomfortable on your flight right well the us150 didnt make you any le squished in your seat so it really feel like you just blackmailed this guy being fat one said11 – others were supportive12 – you had every right to ask the flight attendant solution and between the man and you solution wa agreed upon everyone else can relax because it wasnt their seat being overtaken on flight the other man and wanted13 – however another said the real problem wa with the airline themselves14 – but until consumer organize and demand that airline stop cramming more and alice ’ s adventure in wonderlandby lewis carrollchapter 1 – down the rabbitholealice wa beginning to get very tired of sitting by her sister on the bank and of having nothing to once or twice she had peeped into the book her sister wa reading but it had picture or conversation in it ‘ and what is the use of book ’ thought alice ‘ without picture or conversation ’ so she wa considering in her own mind well she could the hot day made her feel very sleepy and stupid whether the pleasure of making daisy chain would be worth the trouble of getting up and picking the daisy when suddenly white rabbit with pink eye ran close by herthere wa nothing so very remarkable in that nor did alice think it so very much out of the way to hear the rabbit say to itself ‘ oh dear oh dear i shall be late ’ when she thought it over afterwards it occurred to her that she ought to have wondered at this but at the time it all seemed quite natural but when the rabbit actually took watch out of it waistcoatpocket and looked at it and then hurried on alice started to her foot it flashed across her mind that she had never before seen rabbit with either waistcoatpocket or watch to take out of it and burning with curiosity she ran across the field after it and fortunately wa just in time to see it pop down large rabbithole under the hedgein another moment down went alice after it never once considering how in the world she wa to get out againno trecho acima alice decide seguir coelho

the heyday of the silentsgeoffrey nowellsmithby the middle of the 1920s the cinema had reached peak of splendour which in certain respect it would never again surpass it is true that there wa not synchronized sound nor technicolor except at very experimental stage synchronized sound wa to be introduced at the end of the decade while technicolor came into use only in the mid 1930s and beyond nor except in isolated case like abel gances napoléon 1927 wa there anything approaching the wide screen that audience were to be accustomed to from the 1950s onwards it is also the case that viewing condition in many part of the world particulary in rural area remained maskeshift and primitivesource the oxford history of world cinemaedited bygeoffreynowellsmith oxford university press 1996de acordo texto

texto seguir servirá base realização nove questões objetivas língua portuguesa redaçãotecnologia pode tirar ciências humanas idade média diz pierre lévyraphael hernandesfolha spaulo 10 setembro 2019 caderno ilustrada p c6são paulo – pierre lévy 63 começou escrever sobre cibercultura internet mato filósofo pioneiros tratar relação sociedade computador ciências humanas precisam passar revolução passaram naturais tecnologia chave atingir “ patamar mínimo ” “ humanidades ainda idade média ” “ vez desenvolver máquinas inteligentes deveríamos usar computadores tornar inteligentes ” diz filósofo quer reorganizar conhecimento trabalha linguagem faria humanos conversarem máquinas intermédio programação 2020 deve lançar livro explicando gramática dessa língua data editora definidoslévy nasceu tunísia desenvolveu carreira frança falou folha ante vir brasil onde participa fronteiras pensamento salvador nesta terçafeira 10 ingressos esgotados• pergunta 1 vivemos mundo conectado muda sociedadea chegada computadores pessoais internet smartphone aí vai transformam sistema comunicação sociedadeem novo sistema comunicação toda informação acessível onipresente pessoas interconectadas ainda importante robôs capazes automaticamente transformar símbolos fazer traduções cálculos estatísticos novo aconteceu apenas 20 30 ano difícil pensar implicações dessa mudança comunicação começo dessa nova civilização• pergunta 2 inteligência coletivaé algo velho ante espécie humana abelhas acumulam mel si comunidade formigas conseguem sinalizar onde coisas boa comer comunicação coordenação colaboração animais sociais frequente ainda forte mamíferos primatas inteligência coletiva algo outros animais têm linguagemela permite acumulemos conhecimento geração geração serve criar nova formas coordenar cooperar complexas mundo animalcada vez capazes fortalecer habilidade linguística agora comunicação digital aumentamos inteligência coletivaé quase oposto inteligência artificial contra objetivo geral deveria inteligência coletivahá muita memória comum disposição podemos aumentála conteúdo disponível digitalmente podemos aumentar habilidade coordenar colaborar exemplo uso redes sociais público geral empresas governos• pergunta 3 inteligência coletiva amarrada interneta biblioteca forma antiga memória coletiva internet nova forma vez ter palavras escritas papel códigos totalmente materiais têm computador algum lugar falta habilidade educação tirar melhor disso• pergunta 4 tirar melhor dessas possibilidadesvocê aprender controlar gerenciar atenção precisa poder categorizar dado corretamente avaliar confiança pode dar fontes informação capaz comparar diferentes fontes aprender comportar inteligência coletiva trabalhar outros fim transformar todos dado conhecimento• pergunta 5 onde entra big dataé nova forma memória hoje toda realidade representada mar dado tudo gera dado agora problema faremos extraímos conhecimento útil delese toda metodologia científica jogo aqui acho estatística sozinha gente precise precisamos categorizar todos dado hipóteses modelos causais estatística testar hipótesesé reprodução método científico todos começo transformação dado conhecimento• pergunta 6 onde linguagem artificial ieml sigla inglês metalinguagem economia informação encaixaieml língua característica ter semântica computável ter significado unívocohoje algoritmos capazes entender linguagem natural cálculos estatísticos ieml significado acessível pode usado sistema semântico universal faria análise big data extração conhecimento dado fácil dado categorizados linguagem natural porque línguas naturais irregulares diversas• pergunta 7 linguagem fazer conexão humanos máquinasexatamente criada linguagem máquinas podem entender pode traduzida línguas naturais humanos entendam diferente linguagem programaçãoa grande revolução científica frente ciências humanas fizemos revolução ciências naturais humanidades idade média meio uso dado disponíveis todo poder computacional usando ferramentas ieml categorizar dado expressar fatos teorias forma rigorosa poderíamos alcançar patamar mínimo tratamento científico humanidades• pergunta 8 sr vê futuro dessa sociedade digital conectadaduas coisas vão acontecer primeiro todo problema resolvido tecnologia nunca vai acontecer sempre vão surgir novos problemas segunda robôs vão assumir most the gateway international bridge function it should allowing people to get between the u and mexico but on hot sunday afternoon dozen migrant at the mouth of the bridge weren ’ t getting anywhere at all they had been told once again to waitat press conference the next day president trump once again touted the border wall he ha promised supporter “ the wall is getting longer and taller and stronger each and every day ” he said even though construction ha not begun the president ’ s characterization of the physical wall wa false but his administration ha effectively erected an invisible oneit is built in part from situation like the one at the bridge which illustrates the problem with this kind of barrier the practice that trump praise keeping out criminal also punish those who are trying to follow the rulesthose migrant who spoke to time at the bridge had varied story but shared determination to cross some understood bit of what could happen to them next how long could it take to get processed and if they did ultimately apply asylum it remained to be seen whether their story would qualify the regulation governing such matter are complicated and the vast majority who applyare rejected but in theory their fate would be decided at immigration court not at the bordertime august 23 2018 adaptadoa frase nominal “ this kind of barrier ” l 1617 referese

scientist have long touted dna ’ s potential an ideal storage medium it ’ s dense easy to replicate and stable over millennium but in order to replace existing siliconchip or magnetictape storage technology dna will have to get lot cheaper to predictably read write and packagethat ’ s where scientist like hyunjun park come in he and the other cofounder of catalog an mit dnastorage spinoff emerging out of stealth on tuesday are building machine that will write terabyte of data day using 500 trillion molecule of dnaif successful dna storage could be the answer to uniquely 21stcentury problem information overload five year ago human had produced 44 zettabyte of data thats set to explode to 160 zettabyte each year by 2025 current infrastructure can handle only fraction of the coming data deluge which is expected to consume all the world microchipgrade silicon by 2040 “ today ’ s technology is already close to the physical limit of scaling ” say victor zhirnov chief scientist of the semiconductor research corporation “ dna ha an informationstorage density several order of magnitude higher than any other known storage technology ” how dense exactly imagine formatting every movie ever made into dna it would be smaller than the size of sugar cube and it would last 10000 yearswired june 2018 disponível emhttpswwwwiredcom adaptadoafirmase texto futuro tecnologia gravação moléculas dna

menos perigoso “ nazista fanático ” fanático termo cunhado século xviii denominar pessoas partidárias extremistas exaltadas acríticas causa religiosa política grande perigo fanático consiste exatamente certeza absoluta incontestável respeito verdades detentor verdade supostamente revelada especialmente deus portanto verdade qualquer verdade fanático aceitar discussões questionamentos racionais relação àquilo apresenta sendo conhecimento origem divina certezas permite argumentos apresentados simple mortais contraponham afinal colocar lado lado dogma divinos argumentos humanospodese argumentar palavras hitler mao mobilizaram fanáticos tão convictos religiosos origem divina os certa forma cultuados deuses palavras podiam objeto contestação modo ocorre qualquer conhecimento origem dogmática condição fanático irracionalidadenum tempo homensbomba atentados terroristas manifestações racistas ações extremistas pensar fanatismo atual relevante urgenteos fanáticos explica escritor amós oz “ acreditam fim qualquer fim justifica meios ” acham justiça – quer queiram dizer palavra justiça – valores convicções crenças importantes vida julgam algo mau consideram legítimo procurar eliminálo junto vizinhoso assunto preocupante qualquer pessoa bom senso sabe fanatismo provocou estrago hora identificado compreendido combatido tanto preciso saber reconhecêlo diversas manifestações saber onde ter ideia onde poderá ir detidoou ter conceito definitivamente transformado mundo menos louco tal fanático livros fanático chocolate mozart perdoe fanático beethoven contra fanatismo – amós 23 set 2018texto iifanatismo fanatismosfanático caipirinha fanático samba fanático viagens fanáticos tudo melhor fanáticos fanáticos problema empregada tão vontade aliás tantas outras palavra fanatismo banalizouse perdendo força conteúdo entretanto parece óbvio “ fanático novela ” algo bem diferente bem menos perigoso “ nazista fanático ” fanático termo cunhado século xviii denominar pessoas partidárias extremistas exaltadas acríticas causa religiosa política grande perigo fanático consiste exatamente certeza absoluta incontestável respeito verdades detentor verdade supostamente revelada especialmente deus portanto verdade qualquer verdade fanático aceitar discussões questionamentos racionais relação àquilo apresenta sendo conhecimento origem divina certezas permite argumentos apresentados simple mortais contraponham afinal colocar lado lado dogma divinos argumentos humanospodese argumentar palavras hitler mao mobilizaram fanáticos tão convictos religiosos origem divina os certa forma cultuados deuses palavras podiam objeto contestação modo ocorre qualquer conhecimento origem dogmática condição fanático irracionalidadenum tempo homensbomba atentados terroristas manifestações racistas ações extremistas pensar fanatismo atual relevante urgenteos fanáticos explica escritor amós oz “ acreditam fim qualquer fim justifica meios ” acham justiça – quer queiram dizer palavra justiça – valores convicções crenças importantes vida julgam algo mau consideram legítimo procurar eliminálo junto vizinhoso assunto preocupante qualquer pessoa bom senso sabe fanatismo provocou estrago hora identificado compreendido combatido tanto preciso saber reconhecêlo diversas manifestações saber onde ter ideia onde poderá ir detidoou ter conceito definitivamente transformado mundo menos louco tal fanático livros fanático chocolate mozart perdoe fanático beethoven contra fanatismo – amós oz rio janeiro ediouro 2004jaime pinsky carla bassanezi pinskyin pinsky j pinsky cb org face fanatismosão paulo contexto 2004 p 1013 adaptadoos autores empregam palavra “ cunhado ” segundo parágrafo texto 2 finalidade

texto iamizades dilaceradas “ tempo aprendemos submeter amizade àquilo chamamos convicções orgulho retidão moral preciso realmente grande maturidade compreender opinião defendemos passa hipótese preferida necessariamente imperfeita provavelmente transitória apenas obtusos podem transformar certeza verdade contrário fidelidade pueril convicção fidelidade amigo virtude talvez única última hoje sei hora balanço final ferida dolorosa amizades feridas nada tolo sacrificar amizade política ” trecho acima parte ensaio “ inimizade amizade ” escritor milan kundera fala relações fraturadas divergências políticas escrito 2009 ajuda fazer reflexão necessária momento atual vale engalfinhar redes sociais amigo conhecidos colegas trabalho causa políticanas eleições 2014 escrevi neste espaço primeira vez sobre ringue mma redes sociais transformado piorou lá pra cá pessoas passaram sentir vontade escrever maiores barbaridades sentirem constrangidas porque encontraram eco idiotices ficou claro muitos amigo primam inteligência solidariedade desprezam minorias coniventes corrupção compartilham fake news sentem espertos caí cilada achar sabida gente pensa diferente mordida mosquinha razão perdi paciência arrogante intransigentetenho lista grande amizades desfeitas relacionamentos estremecidos causa política hoje cenário ainda conturbado lamento profundamente coisas tomado caminho sinto saudade alguns próximos conhecidos mim sempre alegria rever post boteco amizades nascem empatia crescem afinidades ainda determinadas apenas muitos critérios subjetivos fortalecem tempo carinho dedicação deveriam terminar divergências políticas porque sempre existirãomesmo amigo muitos próximos parentes queridos marido grandes diferenças sobre muitas questões nada agrida crenças fundamentais ainda assim temas rendem conversas acaloradas ânimos agitam vozes alteram português arcaico gente fica puto opinião outro dá un gritos fazer ouvir final todo mundo abraça pede saideira porque gente gosta outro político qualquer todo mundo pensa dessa maneira idolatre candidatos fanatismo reverencia divindades pior cegueira religiosa políticaao analisar amizades desfeitas percebi maioria aconteceu justamente pessoas resolveram brincar cabos eleitorais conversa parece perdida avatar perfil redes sociais treta nome candidato ódio ameaça vingançaminhas batalhas sempre inglórias porque geral posição criticar canonizar adianta político virou muitos herói santo acho difícil acreditar 2018 toda classe exposta bunda janela gente preste papel lambebotas respeito leitor escrevo gostaria outros cachaça outros matamsena pedreira perdi alavanca soltouse pedra bateulhe peito conta deixou viúva órfãos miúdos sumiramse meninos caiu fogo lombrigas comeram segundo último angina mulher enforcousepara diminuir mortalidade aumentar produção proibi aguardenteconcluiuse construção casa nova julgo preciso descrevêla partes principais apareceram aparecerão resto dispensável apenas pode interessar arquitetos homens provavelmente lerão ficou tudo confortável bonito naturalmente deixei dormir rede comprei móveis diversos objetos entrei utilizar receio outros ainda hoje utilizo porque sei servemaqui existe salto cinco ano cinco ano mundo dá bando voltasninguém imaginará topando obstáculos mencionados procedido invariavelmente segurança percorrido deter caminhos certos senhor procedi percorri abatimentos desejo recuar contornei dificuldades muitas curvas acham andei mal verdade nunca soube quais atos bons quais maus fiz coisas boa trouxeram prejuízo fiz coisas ruin deram lucro sempre intenção possuir terras s bernardo considerei legítimas ações levaram obtêlasalcancei esperava mercê deus vieram ruga vê crédito princípio esquivava agarrouse comigo taxas desceram negócios desdobraramse automaticamente automatica mente difícil nada entram trilhos rodam beleza entram cruzem braços virem sorte metam pau tolices praticarem viram sabedoria visto criaturas trabalham demais progridem conheço indivíduos preguiçosos têm faro ocasião chega desenroscamse abrem boca – engolem tudoeu preguiçoso feliz primeiras tentativas obriguei fortuna serme favorável seguintesdepois morte mendonça derrubei cerca naturalmente leveia além ponto tempo salustiano padilha reclamações– senhoras mendonça pintou diabo enquanto viveu agora gostar paciência vá justiçacomo justiça cara justiça caminho aplainado invadi terra fidélis paralítico braço gama pandegavam recife estudando direito respeitei engenho dr magalhães juizviolências miúdas passaram despercebidas questões sérias ganhas foro graças chicanas joão nogueiraefetuei transações arriscadas endivideime importei maquinismos prestei atenção censuravam querer abarcar mundo pernas iniciei pomicultura avicultura levar produtos mercado comecei estrada rodagem azevedo gondim compôs sobre doi artigos chamoume patriota citou ford delmiro gouveia costa brito publicou nota gazeta elogiandome elogiando chefe político leia texto responder questões 24 30prescriptions fighting epidemicsepidemics have plagued humanity since the dawn of settled life yet success in conquering them remains patchy expert predict that global one that could kill more than 300 million people would come round in the next 20 to 40 year what pathogen would cause it is anybody ’ s guess chance are that it will be virus that lurks in bird or mammal or one that that ha not yet hatched the scariest are both highly lethal and spread easily among human thankfully bug that excel at the first tend to be weak at the other but mutation – ordinary business germ – can change that in blink moreover when human get too close to beast either wild or packed in farm an animal disease can become human onea frontrunner global pandemic is the seasonal influenza virus which mutates so much that vaccine must be custommade every year the spanish flu pandemic of 1918 which killed 50 million to 100 million people wa potent version of the “ swine flu ” that emerged in 2009 the h5n1 “ avian flu ” strain deadly in 60 of case came about in the 1990s when virus that sickened bird made the jump to human ebola hiv and zika took similar routewwweconomistcom 08022018 adaptadono trecho primeiro parágrafo “ or one that that ha not yet hatched ” termo sublinhado referese

leia trecho artigo jason farago publicado jornal the new york time responder questões 21 22she led latin american art in bold new directionantropofagia “ cannibalism ” 1929 seminal work of brazilian modernism by tarsila amaral that is part of new show of her work at momain 1928 tarsila amaral painted abaporu landmark work of brazilian modernism in which nude figure halfhuman and halfanimal look down at his massive swollen foot several time the size of his head abaporu inspired tarsila ’ s husband at the time the poet oswald andrade to write his celebrated “ cannibal manifesto ” which flayed brazil ’ s belletrist writer and called an embrace of local influence – in fact devouring of them the european stereotype of native brazilian cannibal would be reformatted cultural virtue more than social and literary reform movement cannibalism would form the basis new brazilian nationalism in which andrade wrote “ we made christ to be born in bahia ” the unconventional nude of negra painting produced in 1923 and abaporu unite in tarsila ’ s final great painting antropofagia marriage of two figure that is also marriage of old world and new the couple sit entangled her breast drooping over his knee their giant foot crossed one over the other while behind them banana leaf grows large cactus the sun high above the primordial couple is wedge of lemonjason farago wwwnytimescom 15022018 adaptadode acordo artigo jason farago “ manifesto antropofágico ” escrito oswald andrade influenciado

tecnologia pode tirar ciências humanasda idade média diz pierre lévyraphael hernandesfolha spaulo 10 setembro 2019 caderno ilustrada p c6são paulo – pierre lévy 63 começou escrever sobre cibercultura internet mato filósofo pioneiros tratar relação sociedade computador ciências humanas precisam passar revolução passaram naturais tecnologia chave atingir “ patamar mínimo ” “ humanidades ainda idade média ” “ vez desenvolver máquinas inteligentes deveríamos usar computadores tornar inteligentes ” diz filósofo quer reorganizar conheci mento trabalha linguagem faria humanos conversarem máquinas intermédio programação 2020 deve lançar livro explicando gramática dessa língua data editora definidoslévy nasceu tunísia desenvolveu carreira frança falou folha ante vir brasil onde participa fronteiras pensamento salvador nesta terçafeira 10 ingressos esgotados• pergunta 1 vivemos mundo conectado muda sociedadea chegada computadores pessoais internet smartphone aí vai transformam sistema comunicação sociedadeem novo sistema comunicação toda informação acessível onipresente pessoas interconectadas ainda importante robôs capazes automaticamente transformar símbolos fazer traduções cálculos estatísticos novo aconteceu apenas 20 30 ano difícil pensar implicações dessa mudança comunicação começo dessa nova civilização• pergunta 2 inteligência coletivaé algo velho ante espécie humana abelhas acumulam mel si comunidade formigas conseguem sinalizar onde coisas boa comer comunicação coordenação colaboração animais sociais frequente ainda forte mamíferos primatas inteligência coletiva algo outros animais têm linguagemela permite acumulemos conhecimento geração geração serve criar nova formas coordenar cooperar complexas mundo animalcada vez capazes fortalecer habilidade linguística agora comunicação digital aumentamos inteligência coletivaé quase oposto inteligência artificial contra objetivo geral deveria inteligência coletivahá muita memória comum disposição podemos aumentála conteúdo disponível digitalmente podemos aumentar habilidade coordenar colaborar exemplo uso redes sociais público geral empresas governos• pergunta 3 inteligência coletiva amarrada interneta biblioteca forma antiga memória coletiva internet nova forma vez ter palavras escritas papel códigos totalmente materiais têm computador algum lugar falta habilidade educação tirar melhor disso• pergunta 4 tirar melhor dessas possibilidadesvocê aprender controlar gerenciar atenção precisa poder categorizar dado corretamente avaliar confiança pode dar fontes informação capaz comparar diferentes fontes aprender comportar inteligência coletiva trabalhar outros fim transformar todos dado conhecimento• pergunta 5 onde entra big dataé nova forma memória hoje toda realidade representada mar dado tudo gera dado agora problema faremos extraímos conhecimento útil delese toda metodologia científica jogo aqui acho estatística sozinha gente precise precisamos categorizar todos dado hipóteses modelos causais estatística testar hipótesesé reprodução método científico todos começo transformação dado conhecimento• pergunta 6 onde linguagem artificial ieml sigla inglês metalinguagem economia informação encaixaieml língua característica ter semântica computável ter significado unívocohoje algoritmos capazes entender linguagem natural cálculos estatísticos ieml significado acessível pode usado sistema semântico universal faria análise big data extração conhecimento dado fácil dado categorizados linguagem natural porque línguas naturais irregulares diversas• pergunta 7 linguagem fazer conexão humanos máquinasexatamente criada linguagem máquinas podem entender pode traduzida línguas naturais humanos entendam diferente linguagem programaçãoa grande revolução científica frente ciências humanas fizemos revolução ciências naturais humanidades idade média meio uso dado disponíveis todo poder computacional usando ferramentas ieml categorizar dado expressar fatos teorias forma rigorosa poderíamos alcançar patamar mínimo tratamento científico humanidades• pergunta 8 sr vê futuro dessa sociedade digital conectadaduas coisas vão acontecer primeiro todo problema resolvido tecnologia nunca vai acontecer sempre vão surgir novos problemas segunda robôs vão assumir poder simplesmente impossível civilização vai evoluir forma difícil preverna resposta sétima pergunta outras partes damatéria jornalística ocorre emprego “ idade média ”

responda questões 55 63 acordo texto abaixoman who stood up six hour on flightso wife could sleep go viral1 – man who stood on plane six hour so his wife could sleep across three seat ha divided opinion online with some describing the gesture romantic and others selfish on the wife part2 – courtney lee johnson shared picture on social medium of the man standing in the aisle of the cabin and leaning on the top of two seat woman lay across an entire row with her foot up this guy stood up the whole 6 hour so his wife could sleep now that is love she claimed in the caption3 – while some commenters expressed disbelief that cabin crew had allowed the man to stand six hour others said they thought the wife wa wrong to expect or allow him to so4 – thats not love thats selfishness on the woman part one commenter said cant she just place her head on his shoulder and sleep love doesnt work like that5 – unless shes sick and this is the only rest position in the circumstance that will make her stay alive if not it doe not make sense said another6 – if that is love then i rather be lonely said third7 – another said i wont judge their marriage my hub is the kind of man who would this but i am not the kind of wife to ask this of him8 – it not the first time plane etiquette sparked debate online9 – in march u man 220 compensation demand from an obese passenger taking up part of his seat proved controversial reddit user big bawluh had been booked on fivehour flight which he said he endured uncomfortably pressed up against to be compensated10 – the problem here wa that this large dude stuck you with being uncomfortable on your flight right well the us150 didnt make you any le squished in your seat so it really feel like you just blackmailed this guy being fat one said11 – others were supportive12 – you had every right to ask the flight attendant solution and between the man and you solution wa agreed upon everyone else can relax because it wasnt their seat being overtaken on flight the other man and wanted13 – however another said the real problem wa with the airline themselves14 – but until consumer organize and demand that airline stop cramming more and atenção responder questões números 77 78 considere texto abaixonew therapeutic vaccine help immune cell fight hpvrelated head and neck cancerreviewed by james ives mpsych sep 24 2018 therapeutic vaccine can …i antibody and t cell helping them infiltrate tumor and fight off human papillomavirus hpv − related head and neck cancer researcher from the abramson cancer center of the university of pennsylvania tested the immunotherapy approach in two group of patient with advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma hnscca and found 86 percent showed elevated t cell activity it is also the first study to show that the vaccine can help immune cell infiltrate tumor the study also describes one patient who received the vaccine on the trial developed metastatic disease seven month later then wa treated with antipd1 immunotherapy and ha been in remission more than two year hnscca is cancer that develops in the mucous membrane of the mouth and throat smoking and tobacco use are known cause but the number of case related to hpv infection − sexually transmitted infection that is so common the center disease control cdc say almost all sexually active adult will contract it at some point in their lifetime − is among the fastest growing cancer type the cdc estimate 70 percent of all head and neck cancer in the united state are now hpvrelated while there are many type of hpv the hpv 16 and 18 subtypes are most commonly associated with cancer many patient with this type of hnscca have good outcome from treatment that includes surgery or chemotherapy and radiation patient who dont respond to treatment or who develop metastatic disease antipd1 therapy is approved but only help about 15 percent of patientsadapted from wwwnewsmedicalneto verbo preenche corretamente lacuna i

indigenous people in brazil seek out city end up in slumsrio janeiro – the dancer shake seedfilled maraca and raise their voice in song conjuring an ancient spirit that vibrates above the traffic roaring from nearby expressway and the beat of funk music blasting from neighbor loudspeakerin this brazilian favela the indigenous people are struggling to keep some of their tradition alive that besides providing sense of community help them endure the discrimination they face in the city forced out of their native land by deforestation miner and farmer nearly one in four brazilian indian nowadays live in urban area and an estimated 22000 of them now call the crowded favelas their homelife in the slum despite it difficulty ha it advantage the slum are the one place in the city where you have the kind of solidarity we indian have in the village said pataxó woman who life in rio janeiro ’ s maré complexadaptado associated press indigenous people in brazil seek out city end up in slum dailymail 16092014assinale alternativa indica corretamente fenômenos geográficos mencionados texto respeito populações indígenas

leia texto responder questões 11 15 it ’ s probable you ’ ve already replied to couple of email today sent some chat message and maybe performed quick internet search the day wear on you will doubtless spend even more time browsing online uploading image playing music and streaming video each of these activity you perform online come with small cost — few gram of carbon dioxide are emitted due to the energy needed to run your device and power the wireless network you access le obvious but perhaps even more energy intensive are the data centre and vast server needed to support the internet and store the content we access over it although the energy needed single internet search or email is small approximately 41 billion people or 536 of the global population now use the internet those scrap of energy and the associated greenhouse gas emitted with each online activity can add up if we were to rather crudely divide the 17 billion tonne of greenhouse gas emission estimated to be produced in the manufacture and running of digital technology between all internet user around the world it mean each of u is responsible 400 g of carbon dioxide year but thing are not that simple — this figure can vary depending where in the world you are internet user in some part of the globe will have disproportionately large footprint one study estimated that 10 year ago the average australian internet user wa responsible the equivalent of 81 kg of carbon dioxide being emitted into the atmosphere improvement in energy efficiency economy of scale and use of renewable energy will doubtless have reduced this but it is clear that people in developed nation still account the majority of the internet ’ s carbon footprintsarah griffith wwwbbccom 05032020 adaptadothe text is mainly about

john milton and freedom of speech on campusby daniel f sullivan few year ago at seminar meant to help college president think about the issue they face campus leader i read john milton areopagitica speech the liberty of unlicensed printing to the parliament of england originally published in 1644 areopagitica make powerful argument freedom of speech and against censorship in publishing after twenty year college president having experienced and observed many call to censor ive come to believe that there is not much to know on the topic beyond what milton wrote over 350 year ago areopagitica wa published response “ to parliament ordinance licensing the press of june 14 1643 ” the effect of the ordinance against which milton wrote “ wa to give archbishop laud who wa also chancellor of the university of oxford control over every press in england with power to stop publication of any book contrary to the doctrine of the church of england ” this wa disturbing to milton who wrote “ good almost kill man kill good book he who kill man kill reasonable creature but he who destroys good book kill reason itself ” adaptado httpswwwquestiacommagazine1p3 1048971311miltonsareopagiticafreedomofspeechoncampus acessado 15052019a relação posicionamento autor texto john milton publicação mencionada

atenção responder questões números 77 78 considere texto abaixonew therapeutic vaccine help immune cell fight hpvrelated head and neck cancer reviewed by james ives mpsych sep 24 2018 therapeutic vaccine can …i… antibody and t cell helping them infiltrate tumor and fight off human papillomavirus hpv − related head and neck cancer researcher from the abramson cancer center of the university of pennsylvania tested the immunotherapy approach in two group of patient with advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma hnscca and found 86 percent showed elevated t cell activity it is also the first study to show that the vaccine can help immune cell infiltrate tumor the study also describes one patient who received the vaccine on the trial developed metastatic disease seven month later then wa treated with antipd1 immunotherapy and ha been in remission more than two year hnscca is cancer that develops in the mucous membrane of the mouth and throat smoking and tobacco use are known cause but the number of case related to hpv infection − sexually transmitted infection that is so common the center disease control cdc say almost all sexually active adult will contract it at some point in their lifetime − is among the fastest growing cancer type the cdc estimate 70 percent of all head and neck cancer in the united state are now hpvrelated while there are many type of hpv the hpv 16 and 18 subtypes are most commonly associated with cancer many patient with this type of hnscca have good outcome from treatment that includes surgery or chemotherapy and radiation patient who dont respond to treatment or who develop metastatic disease antipd1 therapy is approved but only help about 15 percent of patientsadapted from wwwnewsmedicalnetsegundo texto

leia texto responder questões 11 15 it ’ s probable you ’ ve already replied to couple of email today sent some chat message and maybe performed quick internet search the day wear on you will doubtless spend even more time browsing online uploading image playing music and streaming video each of these activity you perform online come with small cost — few gram of carbon dioxide are emitted due to the energy needed to run your device and power the wireless network you access le obvious but perhaps even more energy intensive are the data centre and vast server needed to support the internet and store the content we access over it although the energy needed single internet search or email is small approximately 41 billion people or 536 of the global population now use the internet those scrap of energy and the associated greenhouse gas emitted with each online activity can add up if we were to rather crudely divide the 17 billion tonne of greenhouse gas emission estimated to be produced in the manufacture and running of digital technology between all internet user around the world it mean each of u is responsible 400 g of carbon dioxide year but thing are not that simple — this figure can vary depending where in the world you are internet user in some part of the globe will have disproportionately large footprint one study estimated that 10 year ago the average australian internet user wa responsible the equivalent of 81 kg of carbon dioxide being emitted into the atmosphere improvement in energy efficiency economy of scale and use of renewable energy will doubtless have reduced this but it is clear that people in developed nation still account the majority of the internet ’ s carbon footprintsarah griffith wwwbbccom 05032020 adaptadono trecho quinto parágrafo “ this figure can vary ” termo “ figure ” referese texto

leia texto responder questões 11 15 it ’ s probable you ’ ve already replied to couple of email today sent some chat message and maybe performed quick internet search the day wear on you will doubtless spend even more time browsing online uploading image playing music and streaming video each of these activity you perform online come with small cost — few gram of carbon dioxide are emitted due to the energy needed to run your device and power the wireless network you access le obvious but perhaps even more energy intensive are the data centre and vast server needed to support the internet and store the content we access over it although the energy needed single internet search or email is small approximately 41 billion people or 536 of the global population now use the internet those scrap of energy and the associated greenhouse gas emitted with each online activity can add up if we were to rather crudely divide the 17 billion tonne of greenhouse gas emission estimated to be produced in the manufacture and running of digital technology between all internet user around the world it mean each of u is responsible 400 g of carbon dioxide year but thing are not that simple — this figure can vary depending where in the world you are internet user in some part of the globe will have disproportionately large footprint one study estimated that 10 year ago the average australian internet user wa responsible the equivalent of 81 kg of carbon dioxide being emitted into the atmosphere improvement in energy efficiency economy of scale and use of renewable energy will doubtless have reduced this but it is clear that people in developed nation still account the majority of the internet ’ s carbon footprintsarah griffith wwwbbccom 05032020adaptadoaccording to the context the internet is posing threat to the

it ’ s perilous time to be statue not that it ha ever been particularly secure occupation exposed statue are to the element bird droppings and political windsjust ask queen victoria whose rounded frame perch atop hundred of plinth across the commonwealth with an air of solemn severe solidity but in 1963 in quebec member of separatist paramilitary group stuck dynamite under the dress of her local statue it exploded with force so great that her head wa found 100 yard awaytoday the head is on display in museumwith her body preserved in room some mile away the art historian vincent giguère said that “ the fact it ’ s damaged is what make it so important ” there ’ s another reason to conserve the beheaded victoria statue of woman standing alone and demanding attention in public space are extremely rareto be made statue woman had to be naked muse royalty or the mother of god or occasionally an icon of war justice or virtue boadicea in her chariot in london the statue of liberty in new yorkstill of 925 public statue in britain only 158 are woman standing on their own of those 110 are allegorical or mythical and 29 are of queen victoriajulia baird the new york time september 4 2017 adaptadono texto figura rainha vitória associada conceito

coral reef are colorful underwater forest which teem with life and act natural protective barrier coastal region the fish and plant which call them home belong to some of the most diverse – and fragile – ecosystem on the planet higher sea temperature from global warming have already caused major coral bleaching event bleaching occurs when coral respond to the stress of warmer temperature by expelling the colorful algae that live within them increased level of atmospheric carbon dioxide result in higher level of co2 in the water leading to ocean acidification which is also threat to coral the ocean become more acidic the coral ’ ability to form skeleton through calcification is inhibited causing their growth to slow increasing sea level caused by melting sea ice could also cause problem some reef by making them too deep to receive adequate sunlight another factor important survivaladaptado coral reef the national wildlife federation disponível httpswwwnwforgwildlifethreatsto wildlifeglobalwarmingeffectsonwildlifeandhabitatcoral reefsaspx acessado 26072017considerando texto conhecimentos assinale alternativa correta recife corais seriamente ameaçados combinação seguintes fatores

leia texto responder questões 24 30prescriptions fighting epidemicsepidemics have plagued humanity since the dawn of settled life yet success in conquering them remains patchy expert predict that global one that could kill more than 300 million people would come round in the next 20 to 40 year what pathogen would cause it is anybody ’ s guess chance are that it will be virus that lurks in bird or mammal or one that that ha not yet hatched the scariest are both highly lethal and spread easily among human thankfully bug that excel at the first tend to be weak at the other but mutation – ordinary business germ – can change that in blink moreover when human get too close to beast either wild or packed in farm an animal disease can become human onea frontrunner global pandemic is the seasonal influenza virus which mutates so much that vaccine must be custommade every year the spanish flu pandemic of 1918 which killed 50 million to 100 million people wa potent version of the “ swine flu ” that emerged in 2009 the h5n1 “ avian flu ” strain deadly in 60 of case came about in the 1990s when virus that sickened bird made the jump to human ebola hiv and zika took similar routewwweconomistcom 08022018 adaptadode acordo primeiro parágrafo

leia trecho artigo jason farago publicado jornal the new york time responder questões 21 22she led latin american art in bold new directionantropofagia “ cannibalism ” 1929 seminal work of brazilian modernism by tarsila amaral that is part of new show of her work at momain 1928 tarsila amaral painted abaporu landmark work of brazilian modernism in which nude figure halfhuman and halfanimal look down at his massive swollen foot several time the size of his head abaporu inspired tarsila ’ s husband at the time the poet oswald andrade to write his celebrated “ cannibal manifesto ” which flayed brazil ’ s belletrist writer and called an embrace of local influence – in fact devouring of them the european stereotype of native brazilian cannibal would be reformatted cultural virtue more than social and literary reform movement cannibalism would form the basis new brazilian nationalism in which andrade wrote “ we made christ to be born in bahia ” the unconventional nude of negra painting produced in 1923 and abaporu unite in tarsila ’ s final great painting antropofagia marriage of two figure that is also marriage of old world and new the couple sit entangled her breast drooping over his knee their giant foot crossed one over the other while behind them banana leaf grows large cactus the sun high above the primordial couple is wedge of lemonjason farago wwwnytimescom 15022018 adaptadoa obra antropofagia “ cannibalism ” tarsila amaral apresentada imagem interpretada autor artigo

leia trecho livro dança universo físico brasileiro marcelo gleiser responder questões 12 17algumas pessoas tornamse heróis contra própria vontade ideias realmente potencialmente revolucionárias muitas vezes reconhecem tai acreditam próprio potencial divididas enfrentar insegurança expondo ideias opinião outros manterse defensiva preferem segunda opção mundo cheio poemas teorias escondidos porãocopérnico talvez famoso des relutantes heróis história ciência homem colocou sol volta centro universo tempo fazendo tudo ideias difundidas possivelmente medo críticas perseguição religiosa colocou sol volta centro universo motivado razões erradas insatisfeito falha modelo ptolomeu aplicava dogma platônico movimento circular uniforme corpos celestes copérnico propôs equante abandonado sol passasse ocupar centro cosmo tentar fazer universo adaptasse ideias platônicas retornou pitagóricos ressuscitando doutrina fogo central levou modelo heliocêntrico aristarco dezoito séculos antesseu pensamento reflete desejo reformular ideias cosmológicas tempo apenas voltar ainda passado copérnico dúvida revolucionário conservador jamais poderia ter imaginado olhar passado estaria criando nova visão cósmica abriria nova porta futuro vivido suficiente ver frutos ideias copérnico decerto odiado revolução involuntariamente causouentre 1510 1514 compôs pequeno trabalho resumindo ideias intitulado commentariolus pequeno comentário embora época relativamente fácil publicar manuscrito copérnico decidiu publicar texto enviando apenas algumas cópias audiência seleta acreditava piamente ideal pitagórico discrição apenas iniciados complicações matemática aplicada astronomia permissão compartilhar sabedoria certamente posição elitista peculiar vinda alguém educado durante ano dentro tradição humanista italiana copérnico tentando sentir clima intelectual época ter ideia quão “ perigosas ” ideias acreditava próprias ideias portanto queria evitar qualquer tipo crítica tão imerso ideais pitagóricos realmente menor interesse tornar populares ideias razões possam justificar atitude copérnico hoje ponto discussão especialistasa dança universo 2006 adaptadoem “ ideias realmente potencialmente revolucionárias muitas vezes reconhecem tai acreditam próprio potencial ” 1o parágrafo locução conjuntiva sublinhada pode substituída prejuízo sentido texto

11 fevereiro 03 junho 2018 museu arte moderna nova iorque moma abrigou primeira exposição estados unidos dedicada pintora brasileira tarsila amaral leia apresentação pinturas expostas responder questões 19 20the painting sleep 1928 is dreamlike representation of tropical landscape with this major motif of her repetitive figure that disappears in the backgroundthis painting is an example of tarsila ’ s venture into surrealism element such random association and dreamlike figure are typical of surrealism that we can see main element of this composition she wa never truly surrealist painter but she wa totally aware of surrealism ’ s legacy repetitionwwwmomaorg adaptado apresentação sublinha influência determinada vanguarda europeia sobre pintura tarsila amaral influência dessa vanguarda europeia encontra seguintes verso poeta modernista murilo mendes

leia trecho fala personagem quincas borba extraída romance quincas borba machado assis publicado originalmente 1891— … encontro duas expansões expansão duas formas pode determinar supressão rigorosamente morte vida porque supressão condição sobrevivência outra destruição atinge princípio universal comum daí caráter conservador benéfico guerra supõe campo batatas duas tribos famintas batatas apenas chegam alimentar tribos assim adquire forças transpor montanha ir outra vertente onde batatas abundância duas tribos dividirem paz batatas campo chegam nutrirse suficientemente morrem inanição paz nesse caso destruição guerra conservação tribos extermina outra recolhe despojos daí alegria vitória hinos aclamações recompensas públicas todos demais efeitos ações bélicas guerra tai demonstrações chegariam darse motivo real homem comemora ama aprazível vantajoso motivo racional nenhuma pessoa canoniza ação virtualmente destrói vencido ódio compaixão vencedor batatas aparentemente nada contristador dessas terríveis pestes devastam ponto globo todavia suposto mal benefício porque elimina organismos fracos incapazes resistência porque dá lugar observação descoberta droga curativa higiene filha podridões seculares devemola milhões corrompidos infectos nada perde tudo ganhoquincas borba 2016em “ rigorosamente morte vida porque supressão condição sobrevivência outra ” “ batatas apenas chegam alimentar tribos ” termos sublinhados estabelecem relação respectivamente

leia texto sobre exposição museu tate modern londres responder questões 27 30hélio oiticica tropicália penetrables pn2 “ purity is myth ” and pn3 “ imagetical ” 19661967tropicáliatropicália is used to describe the explosion of cultural creativity in rio janeiro and paulo in 1968 brazil ’ s military regime tightened it grip on powermany of the artist writer and musician associated with tropicália came of age during the 1950s in time of intense optimism when the cultural world had been encouraged to play central role in the creation of democratic socially just and modern brazil nevertheless military coup in 1964 had brought to power rightwing regime at odds with the concern of leftwing artist tropicália became way of exposing the contradiction of modernisation under such an authoritarian rulethe word tropicália come from an installation by the artist hélio oiticica who created environment that were designed to encourage the viewer ’ s emotional and intellectual participation oiticica called them “ penetrables ” because people were originally encouraged to enter them they mimic the improvised colourful dwelling in rio janeiro ’ s favelas or shanty town the lush plant and sand help to convey sense of the tropical character of the city when oiticica exhibited the work he also included live parrotsfrom it beginning tropicália wa seen rearticulation of anthropophagia “ cannibalism ” an artistic ideology promoted by oswald andradewwwtateorguk adaptadono trecho segundo parágrafo “ nevertheless military coup in 1964 ” termo sublinhado indica
